THE FIRST 26. . . .The masks will represent the many nameless victims of these journeys, you can lend your name.

These are the first 16 masks, I have created.  IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN A SPECIFIC 
MASK, THAT IS FINE. JUST REMEMBER THAT THEY ARE PART OF A LARGER PROJECT
 AND WILL NOT BE DELIVERED UNTIL AFTER THE EXHIBITION. 20% OF EACH 
PURCHASE WILL BE DONATED TO MEDICI SENZA FRONTIERI (DOCTORS WITHOUT 
BORDERS).  GRAZIE!

 
Number 1 - claimed
 Number 2 - claimed
Number 3 - claimed

Number 4

Number 5

Number 6 - claimed


Number 7
Number 8


Number 9

Number 10 - claimed

Number 11

Number 12

Number 13


Number 14

Number 15

Number 16


Number 17


Number 18

Number 19

Number 20

Number 21

Number 22

Number 23

Number 24

Number 25
Number 26974 to go ....
1000 Masks



Why this particular art piece?
I would like to create 1000 masks, to be displayed here at Passareddu Artist Residency as a sea of faces. An installation titled "Sea of Humanity" I have been  planning  this piece for the last year, bending the ear of anyone I could get to listen. It is an extension of a small piece completed last summer, composed of 10 masks. We have the ideal setting for the installation.  Passareddu is constructed of second hand shipping containers, my vision is to install the masks at head height and above, as well as along the ground like waves, both inside and outside of the container, to mimic the journey and the sea. Visitors can then walk 'into' the sea and into the voyage.    What you receive


An individual work of art
 To produce a thousand individual hand made plaster masks, is definitely an undertaking. It is very close to my heart, I plan to complete them by September 2016. Inspired by the idea of selling the ceramic poppies from the Tower of London. I will be selling each mask, which will be numbered and signed. Masks will be allocated on first come first serve system. The price of each mask is 50 euros: 40 for materials and creation, while 10 euros will be put aside for a  donation to Medici Senza Frontiere. Each mask is individual. Be assured that they will all be lovingly created, able to be hung on a wall, the color scheme as shown in these photographs: colors of the sea. The masks will represent the many nameless victims of these journeys, you can lend your name. Each mask will be tagged with the first name of the buyer for the exhibition. 
I will be posting groups of completed masks  in the update section, so you can all follow my progress and be confident the project will be on time and successful.
I AM DOING THIS PROJECT IN 10 PARTS. 100 MASKS BEING PRODUCED IN EACH STEP. EVERY LAUNCH WILL INCLUDE IMAGES OF THE NEWEST MASKS.  IF REQUESTS EXCEED THE SET GOAL, OF COURSE I'LL MAKE MORE AS THAT WILL HELP SURPASS THE EXHIBITION GOAL OF 1000.
    The Impact


 The news is filled with  negative and fear inspiring bias concerning the movement of people. Whether from war torn or impoverished countries, I think we have a common humanity that obliges us to assist each other where and when we can. 
Art can be a profound and personal way to share our opinions and visions, and to understand more about our relationships as fellow human beings. I hope this Sea of Humanity piece will promote discussion about more positive and humanitarian solutions. I am also raising money for Medici Senza Frontiere (Medicins Sans Frontiere), which has consistently been on the front line of humanitarian disasters, offering the most necessary and humane assistance.  Note: I am in no way connected to or funded by this charity, it is just the group that speaks to me most profoundly.
The exhibition will take place here in Cianciana at Passareddu Artist Residency. We formed Passareddu last year, as place for art exhibitions, cultural exchange and local and visiting events. It is constructed from second hand shipping containers, pallets and love. Passareddu has hosted numerous successful events during it's inaugural year, and is the ideal setting for this project.     The Challenge


 The primary challenge is the individual creation of so many masks by next summer.  It is a challenge worthy of our combined efforts, and exactly the kind of spirit and cooperation I hope to inspire with the completed project. 
    Other Ways You Can Help


Even small amounts can help this project become a reality. If you're not interested in having a mask, I appreciate your support. Spread the word, share the project. One woman, One year and 1000 masks. 

 Thank You - Grazie! -Hilary

story:
***Pick Me Up title has been changed to It's A Group Effort***

Thank you so much for supporting Pick Me Up! The campaign may be over, but you can still contribute through Paypal. And feel free to follow along on the blog and newsletter

Why Pick Me Up?

We want to create a platform for people to talk about dating and relationships without feeling isolated, belittled or reprimanded. We want you to feel good and laugh a little. Pick Me Up is just the first step of a greater community initiative in dating empowerment that is unfolding itself as we go!

What Is Pick Me Up?

Pick Me Up is our first illustrated dating empowerment literary adventure! The book is comprised of illustrated pick up lines, crowd sourced from our community. Next to the pick up lines are snippets of dating advice, wisdom and tales of love from all sorts of folks. The content of the book is completely community based, and the book is self published under our publishing imprint, It's A Group Effort. Pick Me Up will be silly, funny, pretty, and empower you without you even noticing. Pick Me Up is created by Emma Craig, illustrated by Puja Tolton and written by you! We want the book to be a source of humor and uplifting insight in a sea of dating confusion and problem-centric self help. With each nerdy pick up line and dating anecdote we want you to feel supported, encouraged and among friends! 

Who are we?

Emma is the creator of Pick Me Up and does all the annoying behind the scenes stuff and loves every minute of it. Puja is the illustrator and creates incredible art when no one's looking, wowing everyone. Karl and Will are the guys behind Crazysauce. They are our dear friends and donated their videographer skills and precious time to this project. The rest of the crew for the video are our wonderful friends who are incredibly videogenic.

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $8,500

 $3,000.00 Payment for Illustrator, Puja
 $3,000.00 Payment for Creator, Emma
 $860.00 IGG Fees & Shipping
 $843.15
 100 Promotional Copies
 $500.00 Mid way & Release Party
 $400.00 Promotional Materials
 $50.00 Website Maintenance

 $8,653.15 GRAND TOTAL

Most of this funding goal is going towards paying the people that worked on the project:

The rest of the budget is promotional and marketing. Since we are self publishing through IngramSpark, a print on demand service, there are almost no up front printing costs. We are lucky to live in a world where we have access to this technology! If we went a traditional self publishing route, we would need to pay for at least 1,000 copies of the book upfront and need to pay for shipping them to individuals. Our start up costs are so low because we don't have to do that. With Print on Demand, we receive a small royalty for each book sold, and IngramSpark prints the book as people order them online. Going the self publishing route also means we have creative control and can keep the book community-based. This also means we are doing all our own marketing and promotion. That requires a lot of work and costs money in merchandise, paper publicity and website maintenance costs that we wouldn’t have if we went through a publishing house.

As an illustrator, Puja is paid $3,000 for this project; a flat rate for all illustrations for the book, and images for promotional purposes (such as the images you saw in the video). This is a rate that Puja and I came up with together. From our research, this rate is comparable or better than the average for this volume of work. For myself, I projected that if I were to be paid hourly, I would receive around $7,000 for the creation of the book (10hrs/week at $20/hour for 35 weeks), however I am paying myself the same as Puja. I don’t expect to be fully compensated for my own passion project in the way I would be paid for a contracted job of the same nature. However, it's important to compensate myself and Puja well for a couple of reasons:

-  We are dedicating an immense amount of time to this project that would otherwise go towards traditional paid work

-  We are setting an example that young, female entrepreneurs can pursue creative work that improves the world without running themselves into a financial hole. I strongly believe we can all do great work, make the world a better place and pay the bills. The only way to do that is to advocate for ourselves and believe in ourselves.

-  As women, its incredibly important to be cognizant of our learned tendency to undervalue ourselves and our work. By paying ourselves well, we are pushing against that societal voice of "not worthy," by saying "yes, we are."

The Perks

We are so excited to be offering you some fun perks! Quick note about Indiegogo fees and such. I won’t bore you with math (unless you’re interested!), but the 10% budgeted for fees only includes any Paypal contributions, but only credit card contributions of $15+. If you donate less than $15 we are super super grateful and excited, I’m just letting you that more than 10% of your donation will end up going to fees if you use a credit card. Paypal doesn't make a difference. 

On a more fun note, I want to let you know that each perk includes the perks from smaller amounts, too!

$1 Virtual Hug! Holy moly, who couldn’t use another hug in their day?!

$5 Shout out on Social Media! Like so many social medias – all the tweets and grams and posts

$15 Digital Reject Zine! We are compiling all the pick up lines that didn’t make it into the book into a super fun digital zine

$50 Temporary Tattoos & Digital Copy of Pick Me Up! We’ll mail you some sweet temporary tattoos – your 12 year old self will be so jealous. Also, you’ll receive the Pick Me Up E-Book!

$100 Pick Me Up & Thank you in the book! We will mail you Pick Me Up, maybe we’ll even sign it! And you will be prominently included in our Thank You Page.

$250 Tote Bag! In addition to the goodies above, we’ll throw in a tote bag. And not the cheapo kind but the locally made, high quality grocery size bag kind. You will impressed everyone at the Farmer’s Market.  

$500 Dinner Date on Us! Near or far, we will treat you to dinner for two in your city. It will be romantic. It will be delicious.  Don’t have a date? Practice your pick up lines at the bar and buy cute strangers’ drinks on us.

$1,000 Dinner with Us & Your Pick Up Line in the book! We will wine and dine you (and your someone special) like never before. Our house or yours, it's up to you. Our glorious dinner will be prepared by a personal chef and during dinner we can discuss ***drum roll please***YOUR pick up line that will be in Pick Me Up! Within reason of course, but I’m sure whatever you’ll come up with will be great! Please Note: Dinner with us is for Bay Area only. If you’re not local, you will receive the Dinner Date On Us perk instead, and still get to contribute the pick up line of your choice in Pick Me Up. Pick up line must be chosen by June 30th, 2016.  

What if we don’t reach our goal?

Puja gets paid first and foremost. Artists have to be paid, otherwise who will make beautiful things for us? The first thing to go will be the payment for my time and effort. If we don’t reach our goal, it was me who didn’t do my job fully, so its only fair. But lets not think like that. No matter what, this journey and this book has value far beyond $8K!

Risks & Challenges

Like all creative endeavors, we are going to hit some bumps in the road. We already have! This was originally supposed to be a Kickstarter campaign and it was planned to launch a week later than it has. It was totally the right call to make the switch, but it was stressful!  

I love this project and trust us to bring it to life. It is a beautiful idea that is visiting us and we are just along for the ride. Any problems are just opportunities to learn and grow, even if they feel dumb and stressful at the time. I’m sure our plans will change and things will materialize in ways we cannot predict. I’m ready and open to that. It’s actually more fun then everything going to plan, right? 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is not the goal of this project, community is. If you can’t, or just don’t want to give money to the project, help in other ways. Tell people about the project online, or even better, in person! People trust people, and having your stamp of approval on our idea is a huge honor. If you want to contribute your story to Pick Me Up, shoot me an email at pickmeupoakland@gmail.com

story:
Please help us rebuild our charity website

We are Zinc Arts, a dynamic, forward-thinking arts and education charity that believes passionately in opportunities for all.

Since we were founded in 1990 we have helped tens of thousands of people grow their confidence and learn vital new skills, but now we need your help. 

Our website has been repeatedly hacked and, not least because the messages hackers were leaving on the site were deliberately offensive and disturbing to our users, we were forced to take our site down. 

This means that we currently have no way to reach out to those who need our support, no way to offer accessible web services to our vulnerable users, and no way to stop our charity losing vital funds that may have come through the site. 

Your contribution, however small, will help us to get back up and running and provide support to a wide variety of people, particularly children, young people and adults who are disabled, learning disabled or mental health service users. 

We want to turn a disaster into an opportunity

We were devastated when our site got hacked - we've only ever tried to do good, so why pick on us? Now, however, we are determined to turn lemons into lemonade by raising funds that will not only allow us to create a secure, accessible website for our diverse community, but to also teach valuable IT and cyber security skills to some of our vulnerable groups. 

A pizza-making class at Zinc.

Your contribution means a lot

Not just to us, but also to the people who engage with our charity - that's everyone from disadvantaged kids learning confidence-building drama skills for the first time to people with spinal cord injuries who are given new ways to explore the world through specialist photography and video workshops.  

To say thank you, we're going to put all your names on our website (even if you call yourself Boaty McBoatface...probably) and are also offering a variety of perks. You're also very welcome to pop into our centre at any point for a chat and to see what we're up to. Before you know it, you might find yourself making a pizza, spraying graffiti or simply making a lot of new friends. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, then please consider sharing our campaign on your social media channels and with your friends, colleagues and family. We are also always looking for more Zinc volunteers - if you'd like to help out on a more regular basis please get in touch! 

Many thanks for reading our story.

story:
chalk nfc picture frame

What is the chalk nfc picture frame?

The first customizable picture frame that will help you create your own cool looking frame. Always wanted to use nfc but you couldn't find a nice spot to hide your tags? With our product you can easily use nfc without knowing it is there on your desk, locker or table. The paint we use is made for chalking, has a rough textures and 2 nfc chips are used.


The 2 tags allow you to customize your picture frame to your likings. The 2 NFC tags, which are placed behind the frame, allow you to store different kind of information.


What can you do with it?

With a nfc writing app you can write data to chips inside the frame. 
  • a link to a website, a video, a social profile or an app
  • an email
  • open your camera
  • unlocker for phone
  • make a call
  • a contact
  • a phone number
  • a predefined text message
  • an address or geolocation
  • a WiFi or Bluetooth configuration
  • personalised data.

 

And a free Chalk stick

and use chalk to  make your own beautifull picture frame with your own text and drawings. Our paint is made for chalk and has a rough texture to it. So chalk can stick on the frame. 


Black,Grey and Blue colors


Examples

Have a nice photo off you, with a funny text, your phone number and wifi code to share with friends.

Simply show your holiday photos with a direct link to a online album to show te rest.  And call your loved one.

Share your bitcion link to recieve some money from your friends and share music you love.



Why we need you

To bring you a picture frame takes time, and setting up the production takes money. Therefore we need you to start our business and see if our product is wanted by the market. Also, while making prototypes of the NFC Picture Frame is relatively easy, setting up a mass production takes capital. We need funds to order a large amount of picture frames, paint and NFC chips at our supplier. This is where you come in. Anyone pledging more than 14eu will receive a NFC Picture Frame and be oen of the first to recieve your frame

Timeline


Challenges

We are commited to give you a great product, and will keep you up to date during the manufacturing stage. Beside that, there are 2 challenges with this project. The first, is getting the manufacturing as efficient as it can be, to deliver the frames in time. Second, is the challenge of having a team of just two members. We hope we have enough time to deliver all the frames in july.


FAQ

Will shipping be free?
Yes it is wordwide free shipping, so no hidden costs.
Are there stretch goals?
Yes, we are thinking about it. Maybe add a extra color when reaching our goal.


Rewards

€1 - The supporter

Thank you! We'll keep you updated with our progress, and you will be placed on our website after the project is finished.


€9 - Early Bird Chalk frame!

You'll be one of the first twenty people in the WORLD to receive a Chalkable NFC Picture Frame!


€14 - 1 CHALK NFC PICTURE FRAME

You will receive 1  Chalkable NFC Picture frame, handcrafted just for you!


€26 - 2 CHALK NFC PICTURE FRAMES

You will receive not one, but two chalk NFC Picture Frames.


€39 - 3 CHALK NFC PICTURE FRAMES

You will receive 3 CHALK NFC Picture Frames!

story:
THE ORACLE ART PROJECT @ WALHALLA THEME CAMP

The Oracle at Walhalla will give directions to find your true path in life. At night,  this giant 'hologram' projection will look down on the ’Binnenkring’ or town square of AfrikaBurn and dispense wisdom to those who ask. Like a Magic Eight Ball, the Oracle will be able to answer the most important questions in life. Choose wisely and you will be amazed. To bring the Oracle to AfrikaBurn 2016 and to spread it’s words of wisdom we need your support! 

WHAT ELSE IS HAPPENING AT WALHALLA?

The Oracle is part of our Walhalla theme camp. Not only will you find wisdom and happiness, Walhalla has a lot more to offer!

What's happening at Walhalla, the hall of the slain....

-Boutique; dress to be brave
-Message board; tell the Valkyrie what you think
-Shooting Gallery; are you ready for Walhalla
-Ring of Fire; the power of Walhalla

WHO WE ARE

Walhalla theme camp is a mixed group of around 30 people from The Netherlands and US. The youngest is 12 years old, the oldest…a bit older. Some are virgin burners and some have been going to Burning Man and AfrikaBurn for over a decade.

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

Every Euro, Dollar and Rand donated will be spent on The Oracle. Most of it will be for the material and electronics that are used to get the project going. Since we are creating it in The Netherlands we also have some transportation costs that we need to cover.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Do you like our project but not able to contribute financially? There are other ways you can help! Mention us on your social media, tell your family, friends, neighbors or any random strangers on the street. We are happy with all the publicity we can find to help us fund our project!

story:
Summary

Two first-year graduate students, Minghui Huang and Zhewei Jin, studying Arts Administration in Chicago want to curate their first exhibition—Hello, Strangers. Minghui studied Economics and Art History at University of Virginia; Zhewei studied Chinese History in China. They became friends in Chicago and share the love for art.

Minghui and Zhewei are collaborating on a class project that requires them to work as arts administrators and to promote emerging artists. They came up with a creative idea—curating an exhibition in an Airbnb apartment!

They named this exhibition Hello, Strangers. The inspiration came from their interest in the interpersonal relationship among artists, arts administrators and audience. In their case, they’re working with artists whom they never met before. The idea is to explore the vague and mysterious feelings between strangers—love, care, trust, respect, precaution, misunderstanding… They decided to have this exhibition in an Airbnb apartment, which also implies building relationship between strangers.


Artists and their Works

About fifteen BFA students will be participating in this exhibition. They’re from a diversity of background and their art practices vary from one another. Here are the highlights: 


Elizabeth Lois Housewright 

Myung Jin Song 


Amy Long


Xu Guanyu 


So-Hyun(Chelsey) Park



Parker Wang 


Yu Fengjin 


Celine Setiadi 

Wang Ningzhi 


Al-Qawi Tazal Nanavati

Video: https://vimeo.com/160196246
Darryl Deangelo Terrell


Your Support

Your donation will help Minghui and Zhewei complete the first exhibition they curated in their life. It will be a milestone for students who study Arts Administration. Your support also means a lot to the young artists. All of them are thrilled to make this exhibition happen. Your donation will be used to pay the Airbnb rent and to buy installation materials.

story:
The Harmoniscope is destined for the Burning Man Arts Festival, in the Black Rock Desert, in the late summer of 2016. Current build pictures can been seen on our Facebook, blog, and photo album.


The Project

Imagine yourself stumbling upon a two story structure, pulsating with red light and vibrating with its own heartbeat. Upon entering, you’re presented with 8 stations; seven human-operated ones and the last, a Rosetta Stone to help guide you towards your destination. The only way to get to there is to have seven individuals control their stations while following cues from light, sound, and language to align illuminated rods in the reactor core, triggering a sequence that will transport you to another time and dimension.... 

The Structure

The Harmoniscope is a 9-sided structure that measures 20’ high X 18’ wide. Red light pulses out of the steel-frame exterior and shines out from a dome at the top. Bass transducers in the floor vibrate the entire structure in a heartbeat-like pattern. 


As you walk inside, fabric lined walls pulse with the exterior and you will see a column in the middle that contains the reactor core. This spiraling array of rods is driven by high power LEDs inside each rod and lined with mirrors. Around the reactor core, participants are presented with seven Kaleidoscope stations; each containing four rotary knobs, a speaker, a small viewport, and a rotating kaleidoscope that penetrates the core. 

The eighth station is a Harmonistone, which provides clues to on how to align all the rods in the core and is guided by a graphic language developed specifically for Harmoniscope. Once completed, a very dramatic event is triggered that synchronizes all audio and lighting elements including the floor transducers and exterior lighting.

The Mission

The Harmoniscope requires participants to work together in order to decipher the mystery of how it works and why it’s here. It will be fascinating to look through the kaleidoscopes and turn knobs, generating sine waves and changes within the reactor core. Those willing to make the extra effort of aligning the reactor core will be rewarded with a dramatic sound and lighting event that energizes and triggers the journey to another location in space and time. Our project goal is to make it easy enough to decipher, that a group of people will align it successfully a majority of the time.  

As with any journey to Burning Man, the ultimate destination will be determined by the participants. As they leave the Harmoniscope, their minds will be altered from how they entered by virtue of their experience, their dreams, and their desires.  

The Budget

We are so grateful to everyone who has contributed to the project already! the goal of this campaign is to raise $4229 to transport the project to Burning Man! With each contribution you are able to select one of these fabulous perks:

               


SAVE THE DATE: FUNDRAISER

Join the Harmoniscope team at our fundraising party on July 10th in Seattle! We will spend a fantastic day at one of our beautiful city parks with food, fun, and of course some Pacific Northwest sunshine. Like to volunteer!? Drop us an email here: theharmoniscope@gmail.com and we will be in touch! 

Every share, every donation, every ounce of support is greatly appreciated to help us bring her home. There is still time to donate and make a huge impact on our forward momentum. Be sure to choose one of our amazing schwag options: mug, shirt, medallion, or unique piece of art.

Check out our website's blog and Facebook page to see updates on what's new with Harmoniscope!!!

story:
The 2015 PAC MAC Festival needs your help!  In 2014 it was financed in part by a $25,000 Suffolk County Destination Downtown Grant. Because of changes to the criteria of the grant PAC was not eligible to apply in 2015.

This years festival will take place from October 2- 11 in downtown Patchogue

In 2014 The Patchogue Arts Council mounted their first ever PAC MAC Festival (Music Arts Cinema).  Conceived as a way to unite and showcase the various artistic venues, movements, artists, and musicians in the Village of Patchogue, this enormous undertaking involved many collaborations and could not have been pulled off without support from the local community.

The Patchogue Arts Council is a non-profit 501 (C) (3) corporation and is run by a fantastic team of volunteers.  An undertaking such as PAC MAC takes much planning, coordination, pure sweat-equity and most of all cool hard cash!  We need your help!  Please consider making a donation now!

This year’s PAC MAC will be similar to that of 2014 and again we will collaborate with the The Patchogue Theater for the Performing Arts, the artist community at Artspace Patchogue Lofts, Plaza Cinema and Media Arts Center and others. 

This year’s theme, "Pairings”, will focus on the juxtaposition of contrasting or similar forms and media in pursuit of deeper meaning.

PAC MAC 2015 Signature Events

  • Outdoor sculptures
    Multiple curated gallery exhibitions
    Artspace "Open Studio Tours"
    Musical happenings at 89 North
    Original music at Live in the Lobby at the Patchogue Theater
    Film and animation screenings at Shands Loft at the Brickhouse
    Creative media workshops at Plaza Cinema and Media Arts Center
    Artist symposiums
    Herstory readings in the Lobby at the Patchogue Theater
    Spoken word at Roast Coffee and Tea
    "Worldwide Water" a New Musicals production at the Patchogue Theater  in collaboration with Worldwide Voices and the Peconic Baykeeper

Last year’s event was so important to the community.  There was a distinct infectious vibe around town.  So many artists and musicians were appreciative of the opportunity to participate!

Help make PAC MAC a reality in 2015!! Please consider making a donation now!  Thank you and see you in October!  October 2-11, 2015

story:
artgarage is a free, after-school art studio for students of Housatonic Valley Regional High School in Falls Village, CT.  It is a non-profit organization, fully funded by donations.

At artgarage there are no tests or grades.  

Instead, students are encouraged to explore art, creativity, wonder, possibility, and in the process, themselves.  

The magic of artgarage is rooted in its simplicity:

   -it is open to all Housatonic High students with a desire to create.

   -there are three simple rules:  make art, be kind, clean up.

This simplicity is a rare and refreshing contrast to lives that are over-scheduled and chock-full of rules, due dates and to-do lists.

artgarage is one of the few places where there isn’t a constant scorecard of rank or performance, nor the judgement that comes with that.

artgarage is truly a magical place where students can be themselves, and the desire to express oneself is both respected and encouraged.

And by the way, it’s a place teeming with fun and laughter.

artgarage is staffed by adult Artist Mentors who are practicing artists and artisans.  They include painters, sculptors, designers, potters, fiber artists, illustrators and art teachers.

Mentors offer gentle support for each student's individual artistic journey.  They notice when to step in and offer instruction, and when being present and leaving space is itself the best encouragement.

Money raised in this Indiegogo campaign will be used to buy art supplies and provide stipends for our Artist Mentors.

A goodbye bye note from Emma, a recent Housatonic High graduate and artgarage alum.

When people hear about artgarage, they often say, "I wish I'd had an artgarage when I was in school!"  Your support makes artgarage a reality for today's Housatonic High students.
We're beginning our 11th year!  Thank you for supporting artgarage!

The artgarage is a fund within the Berkshire Taconic Community Foundation, a 501(c)(3) not-for -profit corporation. All contributions are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

story:
Hello!

We are Kosmosis, a Brooklyn-based print and web zine & mixtape. We are a biannual publication, featuring art, writing and music from local Brooklyn creators, and artists from around the world. 
We released our first edition in September of 2014, and it was an amazing success! [You can see the web version here.] 
We're currently working on Kosmosis Volume II: Grand Disasters, which we plan on releasing in May of 2015.

Fun(ds)!

We're raising money to help cover the printing costs of the second edition of our zine. We value art and the written word, and think that it is important that publications can exist as something that you can hold in your hand. All money raised will go towards covering printing and production costs of the zine. We are looking to raise $500, and anything extra that we earn will go towards future editions of Kosmosis! 

Thank You!

Everyone involved in Kosmosis is a volunteer, and we choose to create this zine because we are passionate about art and our community, and we can't help but want to showcase and celebrate the amazingly talented artists around us. Your support means a lot to us, and each and every dollar will bring us that much closer to our goal! If you don't have the means to donate monetarily, but you have the means to share this, we would be just as grateful.

story:
Who is Cierra, you ask? A recent graduate of William Smith College living in Western New York, with a life-long passion for abstract art. Since I was very young I found drawing to be a significant source of relaxation and happiness, and still do to this day. I am currently in the works of turning my hobby of drawing into a small business so I can continue doing what I love. I am simply asking for assistance because I am in need of resources to help get things started and make this dream of mine a reality! I have TONS of ideas for future projects and am confident in the potential for growth.

Why am I here? I am in need of funds to purchase supplies that would help to produce and sell my work at a professional level. I would like to invest in a new Apple laptop and Adobe Photoshop software for editing purposes. I currently work at home and am looking into renting a studio space as I have limited space at present. Supplies such as high quality no-bleed paper and canvas paper, Sharpie oil based paint markers, other sketching tools, and shipping materials are also necessary.

Who else will benefit? My passion for art coincides with my love for the environment. My schooling in the environmental field has to be involved in the mix, of course! I have a strong passion for environmental sustainability and education relating to the problem of over-consumption of goods. I will be donating a portion of my profits to the Environmental Studies Summer Youth Institute (ESSYI) program at the college in which I received my Bachelor’s degree. I was accepted into and participated in this program myself while in high school, and would love to give back to the single experience that sprouted my passion for environmental sustainability.

How else can you help? By spreading the word about my campaign and my art in general by sharing this page! It would be just as helpful and I appreciate any efforts in doing so. Getting started is the hardest part but I am confident that I will be successful. Thank you for taking the time out to read my pitch and please feel free to contact me with any questions.


Thank you!!

story:
WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

We are providing on-the -ground direct mental health services via expressive arts therapies, yoga and trauma-informed care to girls and women who are at-risk or survivors of human trafficking.  We are being called to expand to other parts of Asia to provide services to under-served children and women.   We are professionally trained psychotherapists, artists and healers who want to provide these services and train local caregivers and social workers to sustain this work locally. 

There is very little funding focus from governmental organizations and communtieis concerning this population which is a global health crisis and social justice issue.  Victims of economic and ethnic/racial inequality as well as education and social injustice, they need our help to empower themselves. 

A tree begins with a single seed.  Help us with the seeds and we know and trust we can grow a forest of healing and empowerment.

We can't do it without you.  If you have been blessed with safety, freedom and love, can you offer a seed of this blessing to this wonderful population?  If you weren't blessed and somehow through love and goodness, got through it, why not give back and share the abundance. 

What We Need & What You Get


We are asking for a modest amount to begin sowing the seeds.  We want our generous funders to know their money is going directly to serving this population on a grass roots level, not getting clogged in paperwork and bureacracy.  Even if we don't reach our goal every penny will go to services and supplies to bring to the girls.

PERKS!!!!!
-$28.   gets you a handmade sustainable set of bamboo straws made in Bali by a local family
- $58 2 sets of bamboo straws and a washi-art container of homemade lavender sugar scrub.
-$88 all the above AND a handmade 100% silk yoga mat bag in the color of your choice (multiple colors)
-$108 all of the above AND designation as a sponsor on our HAPPI website
-$508 all of the above AND one free 1-1 private yoga -art therapy class with our founder Ali Guida Smith, MFT, RYT (Bay Area Only)
-$1008  all of the above and designation as a SEED FUNDER for HAPPI on our website and advertising materials.

Risks & Challenges

We have a track record for bringing these services to this population in Asia and have funded it 100% with personal funds.  The only challenge is getting it to all the people who need our services and with your help, we can overcome this challenge!

Other Ways You Can Help

-Make some noise about our compaign! Please share with others.
-Arts materials, instruments, etc. for our projects?   Send them our way.
-pay for shipping our materials to the countries where we will be working?
-Let us know if you know of a local organization who needs our help

And that's all there is to it.


THANK YOU!

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP
 We are providing on-the -ground direct mental health services via expressive arts therapies, yoga and trauma-informed care to girls and women who are at-risk or survivors of human trafficking.  We are being called to expand to other parts of Asia to provide services to under-served children and women.   We are professionally trained psychotherapists, artists and healers who want to provide these services and train local caregivers and social workers to sustain this work locally.  
There is very little funding focus from governmental organizations and communtieis concerning this population which is a global health crisis and social justice issue.  Victims of economic and ethnic/racial inequality as well as education and social injustice, they need our help to empower themselves.  
A tree begins with a single seed.  Help us with the seeds and we know and trust we can grow a forest of healing and empowerment.We can't do it without you.  If you have been blessed with safety, freedom and love, can you offer a seed of this blessing to this wonderful population?  If you weren't blessed and somehow through love and goodness, got through it, why not give back and share the abundance.  
  What We Need & What You Get
We are asking for a modest amount to begin sowing the seeds.  We want our generous funders to know their money is going directly to serving this population on a grass roots level, not getting clogged in paperwork and bureacracy.  Even if we don't reach our goal every penny will go to services and supplies to bring to the girls.PERKS!!!!!-$28.   gets you a handmade sustainable set of bamboo straws made in Bali by a local family- $58 2 sets of bamboo straws and a washi-art container of homemade lavender sugar scrub.-$88 all the above AND a handmade 100% silk yoga mat bag in the color of your choice (multiple colors)-$108 all of the above AND designation as a sponsor on our HAPPI website-$508 all of the above AND one free 1-1 private yoga -art therapy class with our founder Ali Guida Smith, MFT, RYT (Bay Area Only)-$1008  all of the above and designation as a SEED FUNDER for HAPPI on our website and advertising materials.   Risks & ChallengesWe have a track record for bringing these services to this population in Asia and have funded it 100% with personal funds.  The only challenge is getting it to all the people who need our services and with your help, we can overcome this challenge!
  Other Ways You Can Help-Make some noise about our compaign! Please share with others.-Arts materials, instruments, etc. for our projects?   Send them our way.-pay for shipping our materials to the countries where we will be working?-Let us know if you know of a local organization who needs our help   And that's all there is to it.THANK YOU!

story:
Image © Maud Sulter 2002. Courtesy of the Estate of Maud Sulter

Our campaign has closed. To contact us please email MaudSulterPassion@gmail.com or find us on Facebook
Maud Sulter (1960-2008) was an award-winning artist and writer of Ghanaian and Scottish descent who lived and worked in Britain. Her significance today lies in her dramatic and bold re-invention of the imagery of Black women and her art emphasises the long-standing presence of Africa in western art and modernity. She exhibited widely and represented Britain at Africus, the Johannesburg Biennale of 1995. Her art has been acquired by numerous private and public collections. As A Blackwoman was the title of her first collection of poems, and this perspective shaped her work as an artist, writer, curator, film-maker and cultural historian. She edited a pioneering collection of writings and images, Passion: Discourses on Blackwomen’s Creativity, founded Urban Fox Press, networked internationally in Black feminist and lesbian movements, curated nearly 20 exhibitions, and set up a gallery, Rich Women of Zurich in central London.

Our project is to produce the first sustained publication about her art. Maud Sulter: Passion  will accompany two exhibitions about her work opening in Glasgow this spring. Maud Sulter Passion at Street Level Photoworks (25 April-20 June) and her capsule collection of portraits of Scottish Poets at Hillhead Library (opening 17 April).  Glasgow was her home-town, and she retained strong connections to the city, exhibiting at Street Level Photoworks on several occasions, and curating a path-breaking show there in 1995 entitled Photogenetic: Reviewing the Lens of History. 
Our aim is to bring her achievement to new generations, to inspire and to ensure her legacy. Maud Sulter: Passion will showcase works from her major series of works such as Zabat, Sphinx, Hysteria, Syrcas and Les Bijoux. Previously unseen images and materials from her archives will illuminate her working processes from studio photography to photomontage reveal the experimental nature of her practice. Installation shots, invitation cards, and posters document her life and work.  

What We Need & What You Get


Our rewards are special. We offer unused copies of rare items – invitation cards, exhibition brochures, and collections of Maud Sulter’s writings. These are books that Maud designed and published. They are all limited editions, and you cannot buy them today. We are producing a limited edition souvenir digital card with the names of donors over £50. Early bird donors will be personally invited to the exhibition opening.

Everything you give helps us to produce our publication and to extend Maud Sulter’s legacy. We are printing with a small press in Belgium  called Cassochrome, renowned for the high quality of its production and print. 
 Our publisher is Altitude Editions Press, a new small press which takes its name from the Altitude award set up by Maud Sulter to honor Black women artists. We have already raised some of the funds we need. Your contribution enables us to ensure that the book is beautifully produced. Anything we raise beyond our target goes straight back into the project to do more, to secure the future for Maud Sulter's art, and to continue her inspirational work into the future.

Maud Sulter: Passion is designed by award-winning young artist and graphic designer Paul Bailey.  It will showcase her major works, with over 40 colour plates, together with a classic interview with the artist and selected archive materials.    Our exhibition and publication are based on 2 years of intensive research and funded by a partnership between Autograph-ABP, Street Level Photoworks,  University of the Arts London, TrAIN by the Arts Council of England.



Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone who might be interested, spread the word….

story:
Why SELF? What is SELF Festival

SELF contemporary art festival will be organized in Venice at Palazzo Ca’ Zanardi and Venice Art House, starting from the opening day of Venice Art Biennale, May 9, 2015, with a rich program of different events until November 2015.

SELF art festival is an intensive investigation about the SELF. After many years of research and exhibitions about the evolution of the idea of identity, we invite artists to share their personal tales through artworks; to create a link between the personal experience and the audience; to tell us which are the stories and reasons beneath the works.

More about Ca' Zanardi: www.lucacurci.com/press/ca_zanardi.pdf
More about Venice Art House: www.lucacurci.com/press/venice_art_house.pdf

The festival consists of 11 events of photography, painting, video art, installation/sculpture and performance art, with a strong program of video art screenings and premiers, art residencies, talks, workshops, private meetings between artists and audience, live dj set, live experimental dance and art performances.

More about SELF: www.itsliquid.com/self



Who we are

SELF Festival is organized and curated by Luca Curci (director and founder of International ArtExpo and It's LIQUID Group) and Andrea Chinellato (director of Ca' Zanardi and Venice Art House). 


Where we are:

Starting from 2001, Luca Curci with International ArtExpo and It’s LIQUID Group, have curated and organized more than 80 contemporary art events, with the participation of about 2.500 international artists from all-over the world (UK, Spain, Italy, France, Austria, Portugal, The Netherlands, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Switzerland, Greece, Germany, Turkey, Poland, USA, Argentina, Brazil, Peru, Israel, UAE, Russia, Thailand, etc.) with an average of 45 artworks exhibited in each show (with a maximum of 108 artists involved in the great MORPHOS festival held in Venice during the Architecture Biennale 2014). 

The organization has international partnerships with art venues in Italy, Turkey, USA, Spain, Argentina, UK, Middle East, etc., and collaborates with museums, galleries and institutions such as MuMo – Museum Montanelli in Prague, Laura Haber Gallery in Buenos Aires, MIXER gallery in Istanbul, MECA art center in Almeria, CCCB - Centre de Cultura Contemporània de Barcelona in Spain, NCCA - National Center for Contemporary Arts of Moscow, The Ferry Gallery in Bangkok, BAC gallery in  Bogotà, etc.

More about SELF: www.itsliquid.com/self

Know us more through our past events:

Liquid Rooms - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, February 2015


The Labyrinth - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, February - March, 2015


The Labyrinth - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, February - March, 2015


The Labyrinth - Venice, Venice Art House, February - March 2015


The Labyrinth - Venice, Venice Art House, February - March 2015


The Labyrinth - Venice, Venice Art House, February - March 2015


Contemporary Venice - Venice, Palazzo Flangini, December 2014


Hidden Rooms - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, November 2014


Hidden Rooms - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, November 2014


Venice Experimental Cinema and Performance Art Festival - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, August 2014


Venice Experimental Cinema and Performance Art Festival - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, August 2014


Venice Experimental Cinema and Performance Art Festival - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, August 2014



Our team


More about SELF: www.itsliquid.com/self




What We Need & What You Get

SELF Festival can be realized thanks to the enthusiastic work of the organizations International ArtExpo, It's LIQUID Group, Venice Art House and Ca' Zanardi, with the contribution of each artist selected and involved in the different appointment.

Even if we don't achieve the funding goal, SELF Festival realization is GUARANTEED!


20,000 EU is the budget we need to IMPROVE the festival experience through:

  • Realization of a final catalogue which will talks about the experience of SELF Festival. The catalogue will be in A5 format, hardcover, 100 pages with text, pictures and photos. The catalogue will be printed in 5.000 copies to be shared during all the international future events of It's LIQUID and International ArtExpo, and in all the galleries and museums around the world which are partners of our organization, such as MuMo – Museum Montanelli in Prague, Laura Haber Gallery in Buenos Aires, MIXER gallery in Istanbul, MECA art center in Almeria, CCCB - Centre de Cultura Contemporània de Barcelona in Spain, NCCA - National Center for Contemporary Arts of Moscow, The Ferry Gallery in Bangkok, BAC gallery in  Bogotà, etc. 



  • Facilitate art performers attendance. Art performers take part in the show for free, without paying any fee. We would like to be able to support them more, providing them with a pocket money useful to cover a part of their travel and accommodation expenses (for 2 days), and offering them all the needed technical equipment for their show.
    We usually host about 5 live performers for each event we organize.
    For the first appointments of the Festival in May, we will host the amazing live performance of Candida Kandinskij, a one-man band, industrial rock project, curated by the visual artist Giovanni De Benedetto; the experimental dance performance of Alexandra Foffano and Angelica Stecchi; the elegant dance choreography of Jonathan Tabacchiera.


    "Premature 23" by Giovanni De Benedetto



    "Magma" by Alexandra Foffano and Angelica Stecchi


    "Omaggio a Francesco Paolo Tosti" by Jonathan Tabacchiera


  • Projecting art videos of famous international video artists, covering all the needed costs for screening them and for requested technical equipment. The more money we raise, the more amazing artists we will be able to project during the shows.

  • Hosting a rich program of talks and workshops to achieve an active participation and exchange between artists, academics and the general public.
    Among the workshops programmed, the artist and theorist Simonetta Moro, director of IDSVA, the Institute for Doctoral Studies in the Visual Arts of Portland (USA), will present a huge art project at Venice Art House for the whole month of May 2015 and have lectures and workshops during the festival.


    Venice map installation by Simonetta Moro

  • Production of SELF's gadgets and promotional materials: 1.000 pencils, 1.000 bags, 5.000 stickers, 10.000 invitation cards.


At the end of the campaign, the total amount of budget we raise, will be divided among the different purposes.

The more donations we receive, the more stunning live performers, famous art video projections and significant workshops we will offer to the audience!

More about SELF: www.itsliquid.com/self


Some pictures of past live performances:

Borders and Disorders - Venice, Venice Art House, March 2015



Liquid Rooms - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, February 2015


Liquid Rooms - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, February 2015


Liquid Rooms - Venice, Venice Art House, February 2015


Contemporary Venice - Venice, Palazzo Flangini, December 2014


Hidden Rooms - Venice, Palazzo Ca' Zanardi, November 2014




Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't afford to contribute doesn't mean that you can't help!

  • Help us spread the campaign and make some noise about it. Use the sharing tools on this page and let your friends know about the campaign and the festival.
  • If you are in Venice from May to November 2015, you can be volunteer at the festival! Contact us at lucacurci@lucacurci.com for availability.
  • Interested in sponsoring the festival? Email us at lucacurci@lucacurci.com for more information!
  • Come out to this year’s exhibitions, events, and other programming, and show your support.





FAQ

- Will Self festival still happen if this project doesn’t get fully funded?
Self festival 2015 will still be happening at the same date and times it was scheduled. However, we would love as much of your help as we can get so that we can make this year’s Self festival an unforgettable event for everyone involved.

- How can you realize the festival?
The main budget to realize the different exhibitions comes from the participation fee deposited by exhibited artists, which permits us to manage the organization and logistic phases of the whole festival; to provide with installation and dismounting service; to provide with technical equipment for the exhibition; to manage the global and local press office before and during the event; to create, print and share invitation cards and promotional materials; to realize the dedicated website, event page and event dedicated article; to organize the opening parties and ceremonies with the invitation of collectors, institutions, art critics and interested public to the show; to provide with hostess service and collaborators during the opening and for the whole duration of the show.

- I'd like to upgrade my perk! How do I do this?
If you want to upgrade your perk, simply enter the difference between your initial contribution and the final contribution you want to send into the entry form on the right-hand side of the page, then click 'Contribute Now' to send in the amount. Once you've done so, simply forward us the e-mail from Indiegogo to us at lucacurci@lucacurci.com, and we will take note of the upgrade for you.

story:
My name is Allison Bouganim and I'm an 18-year-old from Miami, currently living and working in San Francisco. I am a 2017 YoungArts Finalist in visual arts and a 2016 Silver Knight honorable mention in art. 
I am a triplet with both of my siblings in college, while I am pursuing the untraditional path of alternative education and project-based learning (not similar to #alternativefacts). I have a schooling background in Industrial Design, which enabled me to get a full-time job as a Designer at Fjord. On the side, I am an (unpaid) photographer at the Nasdaq Entrepreneurial Center and a full-time artist. At the age of 15 I started my own internationally recognized business and at 17 I started my own non-profit organization collaborating with a local homeless shelter for women and children in Miami. 
My life is pretty busy- to say the least, but everything I do is for a cause greater than myself. 

For my upcoming exhibition, I am working with rape survivors, and other women, to create the sculptures. I will then photograph them in places where they have personally be harassed or felt threatened. The goal of these sculptures is to allow their stories and voices be heard.All of the money goes into the production of these sculptures. I am working one on one with the brave women who have volunteered to be a part of this exhibit, to create the sculptures. From the first step of making the sculptures from actual molds of the women to the phrases and functions of the sculptures, all the way to setting the sculptures up in places where they have been harassed. I want these sculptures to be used as a vessel of release, coping, and finally having their stories heard. Too many times these accusations of real life harassment and assault are often ignored, so my goal is to create something that CAN'T be ignored. Since I am using electronics, the more money I put into the materials, the better the quality. That is why every dollar helps :) 

The work that I have made leading up to this series has been featured in several publications including The Creators Project and the Miami New Times. 

Other ways to help besides monetary contributions is to spread the word and share.
Every little bit helps and every bit of exposure helps bring awareness to these issues and hopefully gets us closer to solving this problem. 

I appreciate everyone who has taken the time to read this! 
Thank you

story:
The Extended Version

We are a group of female performance artists making a film that challenges the still ever present constructs of patriarchy! Our film questions societal roles and exposes the complex nature of femininity. We are making space for more diversty in a male dominated genre of filmmaking. TriTonia is an homage to grindhouse and slasher films which are commonly associated with the exploitation of women. Our film places women in a primal and animalistic place of power and leadership. To keep it real we're shooting on Super8 and 16mm film.

Three feral beings bound by the blood of companionship summon their prey through the macabre and erotic tunnels of their minds. Invested in the common necessity of survival, they meet their prey in violent and perverse encounters extracting the life force which momentarily allays their desires. Wandering through the moving image, our characters confront dualities of dream versus reality, deity or human, pain or pleasure, revenge or justice. Follow the official TriTonia motion picture page on facebook at https://www.facebook.com/tritoniafilm/

A percentage of funds raised will be donated to Saint James Infirmary in San Francisco 

http://stjamesinfirmary.org/

Join us at our TriTonia fundraiser extravaganza on March 10th to ritualize and party hard in honor of our project and thank you in person for your support!

Please RSVP by clicking the link below. 

https://www.facebook.com/events/1465884106756686/

The Director: Marcelle Marais

Born and raised in Cape Town, South Africa, multifaceted artist Marcelle Marais advances, pursues and indulges the creative discourse with a renegade abandon. Her work rips the socially constructed veils off the faces of genderism, power dynamics and the cycles of abuse in domestic relations. She explores the depths of memory in family myth constructions through exorcisms and ritual immolation of the Immaculata. Memory, too, is engaged with witchcraft, ritual, sex work, navigation of boundaries and psychological blood letting in pursuit of the restoration and empowerment of women. 

 

Why Celluloid Film?

I’m filming Tritonia on Super8 and 16mm film. I've been shooting on celluloid film for many years and find it to possess deeply sensual and rich qualities that digital film is not capable of producing. There is something magical and tactile about working with film. It’s connected with the human instinct of touch and yet each frame captured on film has an element of chance associated with it. No shot can be replicated exactly the same way. There are many variables related to a specific moment in time that can never be experienced again such as the way light and color mix on the surface of film.  When you say ‘action’ and the film rolls you are capturing a sacred moment and participating in the creation of an illusion. Recording a series of still images and then projecting them over light at the speed of 24 frames per second creates an illusion of movement. It’s magic! Film is magic to me and I want to transport my viewers into visual portals reminiscent of dreams and the profound capabilities of the imagination. The sensuality of working with film is evocative and the medium that comes closest to resembling the experience of human memory. I believe film to be the only medium capable of capturing the metaphysical journey of Tritonia.

Meet the Cast:

Angel Novalia

Angel Novalia adorns her world with her DIY creations. She is an alt-model, performance artist, pro-scavenger of fashion and the likes, multi-faceted artist, BDSM delicatessen, and sex-positive feminist. There are no limits to her creations. She received her Bachelors degree in Studio Art and Asian Cultural Studies. She is a world traveler and lived abroad in South India. She indulges daily in delights in the Capital of Earth, Oakland, California. Follow Angel at https://twitter.com/Angels_Domain

Kt Ayres

Kt Ayres is a primarily self-taught artist based out of Oakland, CA. Her different mediums include, but are not limited to, 35mm photography, pen and ink drawings and screen printing. She enjoys creating thought provoking, and sometimes crass art that encourages the viewer to ask questions. Her efforts are to help enlighten others on feminism, sex work and other political issues.

Violetta Von Luxe

Violetta Von Luxe, a serpent of many shades she writhes in front of the camera delivering provoking and confrontational performances. A quintessential apostate, her passion is extremity, balanced with an intrinsic subtlety and finesse conveyed through her anecdotes and demeanor. She is the director's amour. A perfect playmate in front of the lens.  Follow Violetta at https://twitter.com/DominaVioletta

Meet the Crew:

Joseph Dywer: Cinematographer

Joseph Dwyer is a filmmaker and writer currently living in Oakland, CA. His work has screened in many places including Anthology Film Archives (NY, NY), The Chicago Underground Film Festival, Artists' Television Access (San Francisco), and venues in Canada and Germany. His current writing is mostly about horror, fantasy, desire and eroticism in cinema. Born on a Friday the 13th in Rhode Island, Joseph has an MFA and MA from the San Francisco Art Institute and a BA from Hampshire College.

Seanna Lanagan: Production Manager

Seanna Lanagan is a filmmaker and visual artist. Currently, she is practicing magic in San Francisco. She was a collaborator on the short film, Las Bonitas, that inspired Tritonia. 

Community Benefit:

Our film will contribute to the creative arts by paving the way for more female artists in our community. We have an exceptionally talented team of formidable women deploying their creativity and talent in the arena of artistic discourse. We aim to push boundaries by exposing taboos and challenging social conformities highlighting the complex nature of femininity. 

How you can help:

  • Donate to our campaign.
  • Spread the word about our film and campaign to your community
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Support local artists

Your funding goes towards:

  • Hiring incredibly talented actors and film crew
  • Paying for equipment rental
  • Purchasing bulk super8 and 16mm film 
  • Paying for processing and post production of film
  • Purchasing and renting props
  • Travel expenses and accommodations
  • And many miscellaneous contributions that help make magic happen in the last minutes

Every donation is greatly appreciated, and the perks are more than worth the help you'll be providing!

Thank You!!!

story:
WHY WE DO WHAT WE DO

Pretty & Inked Magazine was founded by Editor-In-Chief Natasha MacKenzie to not only support the art of tattooing, but to positively promote successful tattooed women with the hope of dispelling any prejudices or misconceptions and championing body appreciation.

Having always had a fascination and appreciation for the art of tattooing, Nat found herself immersed in the tattoo culture and the amazing talent behind it. While the industry has grown so much in such a very short time there is still an existing negative stigma when it comes to tattooed women, and women in the industry. A belief that tattooed women will never amount to anything personally or professionally.

 

 

Aside from her own negative experiences, Nat has met women across the globe with disheartening stories where these beautiful and successful individuals feel self conscious in their inked skin. Tattoos have helped these women get through cancer, depression, illness and heartbreak and yet they are made to feel ashamed of what they have added to their skin to get through these life changing situations. Women who will wear winter clothing in the middle of July for fear of being verbally harassed in the street. Women who have become afraid to go out with friends for the chance of being grabbed by strangers and abused for their skin. Women who are told they would be prettier without them, and will never be a good wife or a good mother with them.

Determined to change this negative stigma in society, make tattooed women just as accepted publicly as they are in tattoo culture, and allow tattooed women to be more than mere sex objects, Nat pulled together a team of like-minded industry professionals and founded Pretty & Inked Magazine. A magazine to educate the masses on the art of tattooing, go in-depth with tattoo artists and their unwaverable dedication to the craft, and to promote Tattoo Bettys - women who are successful, talented, beautiful and tattooed.


 

WE CAN'T CHANGE THE WORLD WITHOUT YOU

Pretty & Inked Magazine started with two pre-issues before heading for our official launch, with Issue No.1, this fall. With your help we will not only be able to keep this magazine going and inspire these 'Tattoo Bettys' to be their wonderful selves, we will reach new heights and new borders when it comes to vanquishing this negative stigma and the realisation of tattoos as a fine art form.

Exclusive content, in-depth interviews, stunning photography, and heartwarming stories are just a few of the things this magazine can only get across on a printed page. It's an independent publication for an alternative mind.
 


 

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL HELP

You will be directly responsible for seeing our first official issue realised in print and helping us launch a new social change to a greater audience. Your contributions will go directly towards the cost of having the magazine physically made (printing and publishing) and the costs it takes to distribute this magazine (shipping and delivery).

By helping us increase the exposure of Pretty & Inked in local shops and increasing distribution across the globe, you're not only helping us but the artists who spend hours on end honing their craft, and thousands of tattooed women around the world to be themselves. With the support of this initial launch not only will we be able to get Issue No.1 off the ground, we will be able to continue this publication for years to come.

Of course for all of this to happen we need funding to not only print and distribute the first issue, but to give us a launching pad to start to grow the publication. For our lovely supporters who have seen our pre-issues, they were only a glimpse into what Pretty & Inked is bringing to your coffee tables with Issue No.1. The overall design and content of the magazine goes further into the art, the education behind tattoos, in-depth never before seen interviews with the masters in the industry, and double features on amazing tattooed women from around the globe and their inspiring stories on how they overcame difficulty, negativity, and adversity. And of course, paired with some jaw-dropping photography.

Ready to change the world?
 


 

Risks & Challenges

Our independent publication is run purely on the support of like-minded individuals determined to change the world's view on tattoos and tattooed women. Running this magazine out of our own pockets for the last two issues we are now at a point where we cannot keep going without your contributions. Blood, sweat, tears, and countless sleepless hours go into each issue and we wouldn't have it any other way. We believe in what we are trying to achieve, but have reached a point where we cannot make as much of an impact without you.

If our funding goals are not met Issue No.1 will be printed and head into stores and around the globe, but this would mean even greater challenges lie ahead of us than the one we are facing right now. A mission to change the world requires passion and funding, we have buckets of passion we just need help with the funding.

 

LET'S DO THIS!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Please share this campaign on your social media pages. Send this URL to your art, tattoo, and creative lifestyle friends and families! The more you share, the more the chances we have to change the lives of others and the world's tattooed view.  Thank you so much for your support, no matter what the level, our sense of gratitude will be everlasting.

 

THE PERKS!

$5 - Thank you SO MUCH

Contributions made at this level are the foundation for making Pretty & Inked's first official issue. Thanks will be given to you publicly on The Pretty & Inked Facebook page, as well as within the first printed issue. Every dollar counts!

$20 - 'Tattoo Betty' Stickers

6 Limited Edition illustrated glossy stickers that are everything tattoo and everything Pretty & Inked. Decorate your notebooks, your mac books, your sticker books and represent your inner Tattoo Betty.

$20 - 'Tattoo Artist' Stickers

6 Limited Edition illustrated glossy stickers that are everything tattoo and everything Pretty & Inked. Decorate your notebooks, your mac books, your sticker books and represent your inner Tattoo Artist.

$35 - 'Tattoo Betty' & 'Tattoo Artist' Stickers

12 Limited Edition illustrated glossy stickers that are everything tattoo and everything Pretty & Inked. Decorate your notebooks, your mac books, your sticker books and represent your inner Tattoo Betty and you inner Tattoo Artist.

$45 - Pretty & Inked Magazine!

Our very first official issue of Pretty & Inked Magazine! Woohoo! Packed with all things tattoo art and culture it gives you an inside look at what goes into tattooing, the issues the industry is facing, in-depth artist profiles, Tattoo Betty features, and everything you need for a tattooed life. In this issue we chat with Ami James of Miami Ink, Kat Williams from Rock 'n' Roll Bride, and more!

$75 - Pretty & Inked Magazine + Stickers

Our very first official issue of Pretty & Inked Magazine with all things tattoo art and culture, plus 12 Limited Edition illustrated glossy stickers that are everything tattoo and everything Pretty & Inked.

$90 - Pretty & Inked Magazine + Tote Bag

Our very first official issue of Pretty & Inked Magazine with all things tattoo art and culture, plus a Pretty & Inked canvas tote bag to not only sport the goods, but claim your part of the Pretty & Inked army.

$90 - Pretty & Inked Magazine + T Shirt

Our very first official issue of Pretty & Inked Magazine with all things tattoo art and culture, plus our own branded Pretty & Inked T-shirt.

$250 - Pretty & Inked Magazine VIP Package

This is the BIG one. This VIP package includes our very first official issue of Pretty & Inked Magazine, a Pretty & Inked canvas tote bag to sport the goods, 12 Limited Edition illustrated glossy stickers, our Pretty & Inked t-shirt, AND two tickets to your local tattoo convention.

$500 - Pretty & Inked Sponsorship

You love tattoos, you are an artist to your core, and you heart Tattoo Bettys just like us. It is this kind of love and support that our team just is so incredibly humbled by. For those that want to help us spread the word, change the industry, and change some very deserving women's lives we have our sponsorship levels. You not only will receive a special edition of our very first issue (special cover! OooOooO!) you will receive your very own thank you and dedication in the issue. We cannot do what we do, without supporters like you. Thank you.

story:
Honoring The Divine Feminine Through Body Paint

My soul purpose for body painting is, not only to show the beauty of the human figure, but also to honor this as a true Art form. Body painting allows me to pay homage to the goddess that lives in all, male and female alike, and to open channels for Healing.
I hope this book inspires you to follow your dreams and to recognize your own Divinity.
This long-awaited project has finally come to fruition with the help of countless friends and photographers who all believed in the idea and donated their time and energy.

Featured Goddesses

I illustrated the goddess in all cultures and faiths. My intention was to lift up the divine feminine and help balance the energy between our masculine and feminine aspects; to bring us to our rightful place in what has been thousands of years of patriarchal rule. Every new step was guided and every wish, even when I didn’t know how, was shown to me from Great Spirit, the Divine. If I only touch one of you, then I’ve reached my goal.
In my naivety, I thought I would race through and complete my goal within a year. But then life happened. Some setbacks were necessary, allowing for what I needed at the right time, others were a matter of conflicting schedules, but I never gave up. Five years later, I am overjoyed to bring you: Honoring the Divine Feminine Through Body Paint.

Support ART! Buy a book or contribute...

Imagine creating your own fantasy world...
An idea can manifest itself into a scene complete with body painting, custom backgrounds, props and costume wear. That's what I do!
This project requires a lot of love and some money to get it out to the world.   When you support this project, you receive a ton of love from me as well as a great quality coffee table book, prints or a body painting session of my work. 

 

Body Art + Self-love 
About the Artist

Amy Young's 30+year career in airbrush artistry has left its mark on the walls and bodies of Austin and the surrounding area. Her whimsical work includes several Austin-area outdoor murals -- just try to spot the floating pancakes at Kerbey Lane on the Drag. Her large body of paintings on canvas and masonite feature goddess-themed interpretations of fellow fire performers. Look quickly when you hear a Harley and you might see some of her work flying down I-35 or gracing a roaring hood in the Art Car Parades of Houston or Austin. Amy's extensive variety of body painting work spans every age group and interest from childrens' birthday parties to Carnival and Renaissance festivals.

Campaign Perks

I am offering several extras for your contribution please select a perk from the list or feel free to donate any amount to help:

  • Body Painting Photoshoot (includes 2 hrs with the artist + 1 hr with the photographer) - $500
  • Fine Art Print 18"x24" - $55 Donation
  • Fine Art Poster 24"x36" - $100 Donation
  • Fine Art Canvas Print 18"x24" - $80
  • 1 Hardcover Book "Honoring the Divine Feminine Through Body Paint" - $50
  • 1 Hardcover Book "Honoring the Divine Feminine Through Body Paint" + 1 Fine Art Print 18"x24"- $100
  • 1 Hardcover Book "Honoring the Divine Feminine Through Body Paint" + 1 Fine Art Canvas Print 18"x24"- $125

Costs

Production costs, Book design, Publishing, Printing & Marketing - $5,000

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially, you can share this project with your friends.  Tag me + add the indiegogo link:
https://igg.me/at/honoringthedivinefeminine
FB: https://www.facebook.com/airbrushbyamy
Website: http://www.airbrushbyamy.com

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for your support it means so much to me!

Imagine creating your own fantasy world...An idea can manifest itself into a scene complete with body painting, custom backgrounds, props and costume wear. That's what I do!This project requires a lot of love and some money to get it out to the world.   When you support this project, you receive a ton of love from me as well as a great quality coffee table book, prints or a body painting session of my work. 
 
Body Art + Self-love About the Artist

Amy Young's 30+year career in airbrush artistry has left its mark on the walls and bodies of Austin and the surrounding area. Her whimsical work includes several Austin-area outdoor murals -- just try to spot the floating pancakes at Kerbey Lane on the Drag. Her large body of paintings on canvas and masonite feature goddess-themed interpretations of fellow fire performers. Look quickly when you hear a Harley and you might see some of her work flying down I-35 or gracing a roaring hood in the Art Car Parades of Houston or Austin. Amy's extensive variety of body painting work spans every age group and interest from childrens' birthday parties to Carnival and Renaissance festivals.

Campaign Perks

I am offering several extras for your contribution please select a perk from the list or feel free to donate any amount to help:

Body Painting Photoshoot (includes 2 hrs with the artist + 1 hr with the photographer) - $500
Fine Art Print 18"x24" - $55 Donation
Fine Art Poster 24"x36" - $100 Donation
Fine Art Canvas Print 18"x24" - $80
1 Hardcover Book "Honoring the Divine Feminine Through Body Paint" - $50
1 Hardcover Book "Honoring the Divine Feminine Through Body Paint" + 1 Fine Art Print 18"x24"- $100
1 Hardcover Book "Honoring the Divine Feminine Through Body Paint" + 1 Fine Art Canvas Print 18"x24"- $125


Costs
Production costs, Book design, Publishing, Printing & Marketing - $5,000
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't help financially, you can share this project with your friends.  Tag me + add the indiegogo link:https://igg.me/at/honoringthedivinefeminineFB: https://www.facebook.com/airbrushbyamyWebsite: http://www.airbrushbyamy.com
And that's all there is to it. Thanks for your support it means so much to me!

story:
En juin prochain, nous, les cinq finissants de l’École de joaillerie de Montréal, présenterons nos projets de fin d’études et d’autres bijoux destinés à la vente. L’exposition aura lieu du 15 au 27 juin 2017, à la Galerie Carte Blanche, située au 1853 rue Amherst à Montréal.

 

Cet événement est un moment marquant dans notre vie professionnelle, car pour la plupart d’entre nous, il s’agit de notre première expérience de mise en exposition et de vente en galerie. Pour concrétiser l’exposition à venir, nous avons organisé plusieurs levées de fonds dont celle-ci fait partie.

 

Notre objectif est d’amasser 3000$ afin de financer les coûts qui seront déboursé pour la location de la galerie, du vernissage de l’exposition et de la prise de photos professionnelles destinées à enrichir notre portfolio.

 

Selon le montant donné, vous pourrez recevoir un bijou conçu par l’un des finissants et même par un des enseignants de l’École de joaillerie de Montréal. En faisant un don et/ou en portant nos créations, vous nous permettez de nous faire connaître en tant que relève de la joaillerie. Offrez-vous une création unique, faite à la main et réalisée avec passion!
