En faisant un don et/ou en portant nos créations, vous nous permettez de nous faire connaître en tant que relève de la joaillerie. Offrez-vous une création unique, faite à la main et réalisée avec passion!

story:
My name is Sofía Córdova and I am a Puerto Rican-born artist living and working in Oakland, CA. As part of a 6 month residency I'm currently doing at Mills College Museum, I am putting on a one-night only, immersive and baroque performance at the school's beautiful Greek Theater. I have launched this fundraising campaign to compensate the 7 musicians and 3 dancers that will flesh out this future vision, pay for audio visual support (from managing the projection to documenting the performance), and buying the dressing needed for the stage installation. 

This piece will go down May 27th at the Mills College Greek Theater:

BILONGO LILA: Nobody Dies in a Foretold War is a 40 minute new media (live original music, video, and dance) performance slash guided meditation taking the audience-as-protagonist through a vision of our planet 1500 years in the future.

This piece, based on my 5 year video, music, and performance series Echoes of a Tumbling Throne (Odas al fin de los tiempos) takes on as premise a slow ecological decline of earth, which while leading to destruction of historical time as we know it, will also lead to a cultural rebirth for those that remain. I'm particularly interested in what this future, and science fiction as my model, can mean when used to imagine alternative realities for the marginalized: people of color, women, trans and queer folks are the centerpiece of this work. This work is dually concerned with examining white patriarchy & its creature, late technological capitalism, and how both have advanced the conditions evidenced in climate change.

This piece is meant to lend visibility to othered bodies and as such it is comprised of dancers and musicians who are of color, and/or identify as women, trans and/or queer.

The 2 act performance will happen in front of and behind a hanging ship sail upon which my video works will be projected. These videos render our new earth a corrupted but thriving ecosystem, digital while also being organic and unknowable. The characters that the audience will encounter through the dancers and the figures on screen will guide them through desolate shores, impossible ecology, mutants, roving gangs of feminist pirates, and ruined cities, eventually culminating in a visitation from three future deities inspired by Santeria’s Orishas. 

For this performance, I have reached out to fellow musicians I know from my own music practice as well as students in both the MFA programs at Mills' dance and music schools.Their expertise costs time and money and as part of conjuring up a more equitable world, it is key that any and all who participate get compensation for their time and talent. This is the primary reason why I am seeking funding for this work.

For 5 years I’ve been toiling away at this work mostly on my own . The work, however, has called on me to work in a larger scale and with other participants, each lending their voice and imprint to the work, to our future. I feel compelled by our current political climate to, more than ever, make artworks that while remaining disciplined and challenging and of the highest caliber, also concern themselves with real issues surrounding the struggle of the marginalized within and without the art world. 

Thank you so much for considering this pitch. I hope you can contribute something to making this beautiful fantasia real and to its highest potential. Really, every dollar counts so please don’t hesitate to donate because you think $1, $2, 5$ seems small!!

The final event will take place on May 27th and will be free and open to the public, I hope to see you there!!


About the lead artist:

Born in 1985 in Carolina, Puerto Rico, Sofía Córdova is a new media artist with a focus on photography, video, music, installation and performance. Her work looks at the things which plague othered bodies particularly as they relate to late global-industrial capitalism, climate change and technology.

She received her BFA from St. John’s University in Queens, NY in 2006, and her MFA from the California College of the Arts in San Francisco in 2010. She also completed the one year certificate program at the International Center for Photography in New York in 2006. She has performed at SFMOMA, SOMArts and Galeria De La Raza among others. Her work has been exhibited at the Sonoma Valley Museum of Art, AMOA/Art House, Royal NoneSuch Gallery, Southern Exposure, The International Center of Photography as well as other venues internationally. She was awarded the 2014-2015 Kala Fellowship and has recently participated as Artist-in-Residence at the Bay Area Video Coalition in San Francisco, California, Arteles in Haukijarvi, Finland and ACRE in Steuben, Wisconsin. She is currently Artist-in- Residence at the Mills College Museum. Her work is part of Pier 24’s and The Whitney Museum’s permanent collection and was recently the subject of a First Look Feature in Art in America.

story:
RESUMEN

Con mi obra quiero transmitir un mensaje impactante: VIVIMOS ATRAPADOS DENTRO DE UNA CAJA IMAGINARIA, auto-imponiéndonos limites que hemos aprendido en nuestra infancia y cargando con ellos durante toda nuestra vida.

MI HISTORIA

Me llamo Antonio Hernández, soy ingeniero informático y después de un largo proceso de auto-descubrimiento personal me he convertido en escultor. A través del arte investigo en mi propia personalidad y con ella las paredes que limitan mi pleno desarrollo.Tras varios años de formación me he convertido en arteterapeuta porque creo en el poder del arte como instrumento para el auto-desarrollo.

SIGNIFICADO DE MI OBRA

He descubierto que muchas personas comparten estas paredes imaginarias que  nos limitan la capacidad para ser felices.

Con mi obra quiero invitaros a reflexionar sobre estos límites y que sirvan de inspiración al mayor número de gente para salir de su propia caja y trascender sus límites.

Después de investigar con mi obra y descubrir las paredes que nos limitan al desarrollo, finalmente me he dado cuenta de que todo encaja, de ahí el nombre de mi obra.

QUE PRETENDO CON LA CAMPAÑA DE CROWFUNDING

Tu contribución es para fundir las PRIMERAS esculturas ORIGINALES en bronce (11 obras).

Quiero llevar mi arte a un nivel de difusión amplio, y el bronce es el material que se utiliza para que la obra de un escultor trascienda. Desafortunadamente el proceso de reproducción es muy costoso, una pequeña pieza puede costar más de 500 euros.

Es por ello que necesito TU AYUDA para cumplir mi sueño y poder difundir mi obra. Estoy dispuesto a sacrificar mis beneficios en  con tal de poder crear los moldes y forjar las primeras piezas. TE INVITO a que seas parte de este comienzo.

POR QUÉ ES IMPORTANTE PARA MI TU CONTRIBUCIÓN

La vida del artista es dura, no es fácil encontrar apoyos y no he encontrado en las instituciones los apoyos que he estado buscando. Por eso apelo a tu generosidad, así como a tus ganas de impulsar un proyecto de arte que quiere transmitir consciencia. Con tu aportación ayudarás a que más personas se den cuenta de sus límites en la caja imaginaria y busquen salir de sus paredes.

Estoy seguro de que mi obra tocará muchos corazones e invitará a muchas reflexiones, y tú puedes ayudar a que alcance a muchas más personas. No es lo mismo verlo físicamente apreciando todas sus dimensiones que con una simple fotografía.

Tu aportación puede hacer la diferencia en este mensaje de despertar emocional hacia la libertad.

LO QUE SE NECESITA

Se necesitan 7150 euros para fundir en bronce una primera pieza de cada una de las 11 esculturas que componen la colección.

 El coste por pieza para fundirla en bronce es de 650 euros (200 en moldes, 300 para bronce y pátina, 150 en comisiones para exposición y crowdfunding).

Todo el dinero que se recaude se destinará íntegramente a la forja en bronce del mayor número de obras posibles.

LAS RECOMPENSAS

RECOMPENSA 1: ESCULTURA EN BRONCE ORIGINAL CASI A PRECIO DE COSTE de producción (650 euros), firmada y numerada por el autor cuyo valor de mercado es de 1250 EUROS cada una (serie limitada de 10ud).

RECOMPENSA 2: Sorteo de una ESCULTURA EN RESINA FIRMADA entre los donantes de 10 euros, por cada 100 donaciones completas. Escultura a elegir dentro de las 11 piezas, valorada en 400 euros y realizada en resina con pátina tipo bronce. Se utilizarán las 2 últimas cifras del primer premio del sorteo de lotería nacional de fecha 6 de enero de 2016. Los donantes deben indicar su email de contacto para que se les asigne un número para el sorteo.

OTRAS FORMAS DE APOYAR

Si no puedes contribuir económicamente pero puedes ayudarme de cualquier otra manera (ej: con la difusión de la obra, algún patrocinador, precio especial para la fabricación, etc) contáctame en todoencaja.escultura@gmail.com

Puedes difundir mi obra compartiéndola en Facebook: todoencaja.escultura.

CONTACTO

todoencaja.escultura@gmail.com

story:
My name is Zuzana Mantel, I live in the Czech Republic and I'm a painter and mosaics maker. I paint light and color, emotion and vibration. I want to catch magic moments of our life. My creation is focused on natural and human forms. I create with love.

My art captivated many art lovers, critics and curators. After a successful presentation at Tokyo International Art Fair in May 2015 I've got many invitations to exhibit in Europe and USA. I'm really delighted by the interest and I would like to deliver a direct contact of my works with the observers. I know, from my own experience, that watching the art and being surrounded by it brings joy and new pieces of knowledge.

Why is it important to me, what is my goal

Right now, it's unable to finance all the exhibitions from my private resources. By way of the crowd founding I'm asking for your support. As a reward I offer to you ownership of one my original artworks.

  

DNA, 2013, glass mosaics, 30x30cm



What I Need & What You Get

Participation cost .......... 1080,- USD

Accommodation .............. 660,- USD

Transport ........................ 440,- USD

-------------------------------------------------

Total costs ................... 2.180,- USD

For your donation you can become an owner of one of my original glass mosaics or a happy owner of photo print artwork.

More about me and my work you can find on the web side: http://www.zuzanamantel.com 

    GAME, 2014, glass mosics, 22x22cm


Your support is appreciated

You can support this project with any amount. The final amount of money will be used to cover all participation cost. Your support is highly appreciated.

THIRD EYE / detail, 2015, glass mosaics, round, Ø 22cm


Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this project and would like to support it in other ways, share it, spread it, tell to to your friends and others. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me at: zuzana.mantel@gmail.com


Thank You :)

story:
I am a special effects makeup artist working my way into the industry. I have always loved all forms of art, including painting/drawing, acting, and music. To me, makeup is a way I can bring all those art forms into one. My goal is to bring art to life, one canvas at a time. 

I have a flexible goal of $2,500. This will go towards travel costs, costuming, and supplies I need to make the best work and character possible!

story:
Get The Doodlecats On The Road

Our ideas are getting bigger, along with our business and because we tend to come up with things nobody has tried yet, it can be difficult to find venues that will allow us to experiment. A  Doodlecat Bus would enable us to follow where our imaginations lead. And to take a great big bunch of Doodlecats with us when we do. This first phase of crowdfunding will help us obtain a 53 seater coach and, crucially, get it legal and on the road. In a marvellous bit of unintended forward planning (something we excel at) our DJ is also a bus driver!

What We Need & What You Get

Our ideal vehicle is a coach - big enough to take a bunch of people and their luggage to a festival or on tour. We're looking at elderly ex service coaches, which sell for around £3000. We need something with loads of baggage store space where we will install the water tanks that'll make it possible for us to body marble thousands of people whilst being responsible with our waste water. Something sturdy that won't complain if we attach a stage to the side or a slide from the roof... 

Eventually the plan is to remove half of the  seats to create a versatile open plan performance space which we're calling The Back of The Bus. We'll make this available to other rebellious artistic endeavours for cheap or free, and we'll hire it to less rebellious endeavours to create a fund to support new art and activism. 

Our perks, unsurprisingly are pretty much all BUS based! From G&T parties on the beautiful South Downs to a bus based Playpen experience for you and 30 mates, there are a range of pledge amounts so that you can give us some love without breaking the bank. We're doing a flexible fund, because we're good at making do with what we've got (that's doodling!) and any contribution will help us do more things - but should it transpire that we don't achieve our goal of purchasing a bus, you will have the option of our doodled up substitute perk (like maybe we have to hire someone else's bus for a picnic) or getting your money refunded. 

The Philosophy Of Doodle, upon which all our events (and our business model) are based has taught me that too much of a plan is never a good thing. Bodydoodling and indeed The Doodlecats were not so much a plan as a response to what YOU all told us you wanted. Once we have the bus, the directions in which we choose to point it will occur the same way.

In Doodle (and YOU) we trust.
story_txt:
Get The Doodlecats On The Road
Our ideas are getting bigger, along with our business and because we tend to come up with things nobody has tried yet, it can be difficult to find venues that will allow us to experiment. A  Doodlecat Bus would enable us to follow where our imaginations lead. And to take a great big bunch of Doodlecats with us when we do. This first phase of crowdfunding will help us obtain a 53 seater coach and, crucially, get it legal and on the road. In a marvellous bit of unintended forward planning (something we excel at) our DJ is also a bus driver!
What We Need & What You Get
Our ideal vehicle is a coach - big enough to take a bunch of people and their luggage to a festival or on tour. We're looking at elderly ex service coaches, which sell for around £3000. We need something with loads of baggage store space where we will install the water tanks that'll make it possible for us to body marble thousands of people whilst being responsible with our waste water. Something sturdy that won't complain if we attach a stage to the side or a slide from the roof... 
Eventually the plan is to remove half of the  seats to create a versatile open plan performance space which we're calling The Back of The Bus. We'll make this available to other rebellious artistic endeavours for cheap or free, and we'll hire it to less rebellious endeavours to create a fund to support new art and activism. 
Our perks, unsurprisingly are pretty much all BUS based! From G&T parties on the beautiful South Downs to a bus based Playpen experience for you and 30 mates, there are a range of pledge amounts so that you can give us some love without breaking the bank. We're doing a flexible fund, because we're good at making do with what we've got (that's doodling!) and any contribution will help us do more things - but should it transpire that we don't achieve our goal of purchasing a bus, you will have the option of our doodled up substitute perk (like maybe we have to hire someone else's bus for a picnic) or getting your money refunded. 
The Philosophy Of Doodle, upon which all our events (and our business model) are based has taught me that too much of a plan is never a good thing. Bodydoodling and indeed The Doodlecats were not so much a plan as a response to what YOU all told us you wanted. Once we have the bus, the directions in which we choose to point it will occur the same way.
In Doodle (and YOU) we trust.

story:
It's a familiar yet tragic story...at the end of the quest, when the adult dragons have been slain and the knights have returned to the keep, young dragons, injured or orphaned, are left to fend for themselves. 

Many are lost.


(Orphaned young dragon)


Some, however, are rescued by The Glassy Geek*, who tirelessly rehabilitates and trains the young dragons, and works hard to find them loving, forever homes.

Unfortunately, funds are low, and resources are limited, making it difficult to care for all the dragons left behind.

(*The Glassy Geek is an artist working hard to support a special needs son in a single parent household during these difficult economic times, yet still makes the effort to provide the very best in dragon outreach and care.  See below the Rewards section to learn more.)



That's where YOU come in.  Your generous donation can help fund The Glassy Geek's new Center for the Rehabilitation Of Wild Dragons (CROWD). 


The CROWD Fund will allow for expanded dragon saving services, including care and treatment, house-training for young dragons, and much needed wing prostheses for injured dragons. 


(feeding dragon fruit to a litter of rescued immature dragons)


Best of all, the CROWD Fund will enable us to allow some of YOU, the generous benefactors, to care for injured or orphaned dragons in the comfort of your own homes.


(Rescued and trained young female dragon, recently re-homed)


We know that not everyone is in a position to make a large donation, and not everyone feels ready to care for a dragon.  That's why CROWD Fund contributors are encouraged to give at whatever level suits them best.  Every contribution, large and small, is appreciated and rewarded. 


(dragons in supervised flight training at CROWD. Notice the rare frost dragon at bottom of group)


For the cost of a single cup of coffee (espresso based, probably a venti), CROWD Fund contributors will receive a Save the Dragons logo decal; a larger donation will earn you a CROWD Save the Dragons logo t-shirt.  A donation of a mere penny a day (for the equivalent of 4,000 days) will allow you to adopt a fully recovered and trained orphan dragon, while a more generous contribution will allow you to help care for a very special wounded dragon, perhaps one whose prosthetic wing was funded by you yourself! 

So many dragons come into the CROWD clinic in serious condition, but The Glassy Geek carefully treats each one to aid the dragons on their paths to healthy, fulfilling lives.


(wounded dragon being examined at CROWD clinic)

Using cutting-edge technology, the CROWD clinic is able to help seriously wounded dragons with everything from scale grafts to partial transplants.  In cases where transplants won't take, the latest in prosthetic technology is employed.  The CROWD clinic is proud to boast a 99.9% success rate in rehabilitating even the most seriously wounded dragons!

(same dragon as above after receiving expert dragonfly wing partial transplant from compatible species Dragonflyus Giganticus)


As you can understand, it takes a lot of resources to provide these kinds of services.  Every one of your pennies is appreciated!  Got way too many pennies?  Well, those in a position to help us fund for the future with the largest donations will receive a special commemorative dragon stained glass panel.  (See details for each available contribution level.)


Day after day, quest after quest, young dragons are being left behind.  Your donations, large and small, could make all the difference.  Won't you please help?

(iridescent pale blue dragon seeking a forever home at re-homing event)

Okay, they're hanging stained glass dragons...but here at CROWD, we believe no dragon should be left homeless and suffering in this day and age, especially not well-trained, stained glass dragons.  Please consider helping The Glassy Geek's dragon friends find their forever homes!



Your kindness and generosity, and love of dragons, means more to us than just a word of thanks!  Here’s how CROWD will reward your donations:


Of course you get our undying gratitude, but you also get a virtual hug from across the Internet!  (You may request a substitute hearty virtual handshake if you aren't the hugging type.)


For about the price of one cup of coffee, you can support dragon rehabiliation and show off your support with a removable vinyl featuring simplified CROWD logo.  It may be placed on pretty much any smooth surface, such as car windows, laptops, walls, refrigerators, and so on.


For the cost of just three cappuccinos (or a decent sandwich with fries), you'll receive an autographed copy of Dragon Run by Patrick Matthews!  This perk is limited to the first ten people to claim it.


Fused glass pendant featuring a sepia tone Welsh dragon on an ivory glass background, set against lovely clear red glass, hung from a standard cord necklace that you may keep or replace with your own chain.  Each one is hand made by The Glassy Geek, and will therefore be unique (shapes will vary due to hand made nature of this item).


Unisex t-shirt, either digital or screen printed (depending on quantity claimed), just like those worn by CROWD clinic staff!  Shirts will probably be a light heather gray, but other color choices or styles may become available.  We will contact you via email to get your shirt preferences.


For a slightly reduced rate over the first wave (see below), the second wave of orphaned dragons will ship starting in January 2016 (if you’d like one in time for Christmas, please see the next reward).  You'll have your choice of glass colors.  When you choose to re-home an orphaned dragon, you'll be contacted with a color list from which to choose.  You may also choose a body color of silver or black.  After all, there are so very many orphaned dragons, I'm sure we can find just the right dragon for you. 


So, you want to take an orphaned dragon home in time for the holidays!  You’re so nice.  If you claim your orphan before November 21, you’ll be sent an email with the full list of color choices.  If you claim your orphan after that date, your color choices may be limited by availability, since there will be less time to get your new dragon to his or her forever home in time for the holidays. 

URGENT UPDATE!  Recent quests along the Atlantic coastline have created a need for homes for several of these special little dragons.  Don't let the toothy grin of a coastal dragon fool you--these little fellows are as sweet as can be, with a jewel-like glint in their eyes!  Wave #2 of the Coastal Dragon Orphan adoptions goes out beginning in January 2016.

URGENT UPDATE!  Recent quests along the Atlantic coastline have left a number of adolescent Coastal Dragons in need of care and forever homes!  A handful of them will be fully rehabilitated and trained in time to arrive in their forever homes in time for the holidays.  Since there are a limited number of these dragons ready to travel, your color choices may be somewhat limited, but we'll do all we can to find just the right forever friend for you!

The Glassy Geek has a special needs child, and cares for special needs dragons, so knows first hand that their needs aren't ALL that's special about them!  Each of the Special Needs Dragons will be completely unique, and may incorporate metal or 3D printed plastic prosthetics, missing pieces of wing, or bandages.  If the dragon is in recovery, he or she may come with a pet cone (a.k.a. Cone of Shame) to prevent self-injury.  I assure you, every special needs dragon is beautiful, and deserving of an abundance of love!  If you'd like your special needs dragon to arrive before the Christmas holiday, please select a Special Needs Dragon Wave #1 instead.


A few of our special needs dragons will be ready to adopt just in time for the Christmas holiday!  See description above for Special Needs Dragon, Wave #2 for more information.  Special dragons need special homes!


Second wave of our “I Love Dragons” rewards package will begin shipping in February 2015, and will include  a special needs dragon (or, if you prefer, a fully rehabilitated dragon), a Save the Dragons t-shirt, and a Save the Dragons vinyl decal.  All of your items will arrive together.  Delivery time will depend on number of perks claimed.


First wave of our “I Love Dragons” rewards package will ship in two phases.  You will receive  a special needs dragon (or, if you prefer, a fully rehabilitated dragon), and a Save the Dragons vinyl decal, which will ship out on or before December 21, 2015.  You will also receive a Save the Dragons T-shirt and a decal.  Shirts will ship out beginning in January 2015.


Created only as claimed, your dragon panel will be hand made, and The Glassy Geek will consult with you to be sure the color scheme will match your décor.  You will see a photo of the proposed design to be sure it meets with your satisfaction before the panel is made.  The Glassy Geek will send photos of the work in various stages, so you can see how your panel is progressing.  Please be advised that all stained glass perks are individually hand made by The Glassy Geek, and that panels are time consuming to create.  Please allow several months for your panel to be created just for you.


As with the $500 reward level, your 10x12 inch stained glass panel will be hand made to order, and The Glassy Geek will consult with you to be sure the color scheme will match your décor.  You will also receive photos as work progresses.  In addition, you will receive both an orphan dragon and a special needs dragon, a t-shirt, and a decal.  Smaller rewards will ship as soon as they become available, but of course your customized dragon panel will take several months to create.


You love dragons so much, a 10x12 panel isn't big enough for you!  No problem.  The Save All the Dragons package gets you all of the perks of the Save Lots of Dragons level, but your panel is BIGGER than THEIR panel.  It's 14x20 inches, and just like the other stained glass panels, this one will take a few months to make.  You will also receive your orphan dragon, special needs dragon, t-shirt, and decal, which will ship as they become available.


Wow, you truly are a patron of the arts and lover of dragons.  This will be a custom window design of your choice (it doesn't have to be dragons, if you'd prefer something else, just nothing X rated).  The typical cost of The Glassy Geek's windows is determined by a set formula, so as long as your proposed design comes in under your donation amount, really, we're good.  Size and detail (number of individual glass pieces, plus any additional work like fusing or wirework) are generally the biggest determining factors for price; the larger and more complex, the higher the price.  Still...$10,000 is going to get you a LOT of leeway.  :)  Please understand that your window is being hand crafted, and this will take some time (many months).  Your patience is appreciated.  You will receive progress photos along the way, and of course a t-shirt you can wear while you wait.  And hey, if you'd like an orphan and/or special needs dragon, by all means, that can be arranged.



(fully rehabilitated dragon, being released back into the wild, thanks to support from kind and generous people like you)



Hi, I'm Dawn Rosner, The Glassy Geek (so named because most of my art reflects my love of geek culture).  I'm a stained glass artist raising two boys on my own.  My younger son, now 16 years old, has autism, and I'm his sole care giver.  Working from my home-based studio allows me to be available to provide him with the level of care he requires; however, art is often a hit-or-miss career, and it can be a financial struggle at times.  Your generous donations will allow me to continue to make ends meet for my boys, provide my younger son with the care he requires, and help finance supplies so I can create even bigger and better works of art to continue working to support my family.  My thanks to you will be a reward of dragon art you can enjoy for years to come.

I have been making stained glass on and off for a couple of decades.  About 5 years ago, I turned my passion for geek culture into a stained glass art career, and started selling as The Glassy Geek online and at Florida science fiction and comic conventions.  I work in both copper foil and lead came, and incorporate fused glass pieces into some of my designs.  I also make fused glass jewelry.  Some of my work has appeared on display at the John F. Germany Public Library in Tampa, FL, and at the Transmetropolitan Gallery in Orlando, FL.

(confrontation scene stained glass panel incorporating authentic, original autographs from actors Terry Molloy and Peter Davison)


("I Am..." stained glass panel)


I have many more ambitious designs I would like to tackle, but lack the funding to do it, since everything I earn is being channeled into daily living expenses just to try to make ends meet.  Lately, even that has become an ongoing struggle. 

If dragons aren't quite your thing, please feel free to visit my website at http://www.glassygeek.com for geeky stained glass, or to contact me for a custom stained glass order (it doesn't have to be geeky, that's just my specialty).  I have additional original autographs available, ready to be worked into custom stained glass panel designs, including a few from Sylvester McCoy, who played Radagast the Brown in The Hobbit!

Every order, large and small, really does help.

The boys and I, and especially the dragons, appreciate your support!


(iridescent green dragon in flight)

story:
Image credit: https://www.burrencollege.ie/college/newtown-ca...

Hello,

My name is Kristen McNevins. I am a visual artist working primarily in photography and been given an amazing opportunity. At the end of this August I will leaving my home in Connecticut, and heading to Ireland to attend a 4 week artist residency at The Burren College of Art. I recently finished a series, Out of Habit,  in completion of MFA in photography from the Savannah College of Art and Design, and now that I am finished I am looking for opportunities to make my next series. Usually, I travel light when I make work, relying on my camera and my immediate surroundings as a source of creativity. I think Ireland's stunning landscapes, and the thrill of being in a place will provide a great source of inspiration for me, motivating me to photograph more to add to my body of work.

If you're interested, you can check out some of my current work at http://www.kristenmcnevins.com/.

Right now, I don't have much of a studio space or any means to print my photographs, so I intend to use the facilities for digital printing often. My primary purpose of this residency is to have the time and space to focus and work on my own, but I am also interested in contributing to art and college community at Burren College of Art during my four week stay. I hope that the experiences will cultivate feedback for my own work, as well as add more skills necessary to be articulate as a lecturer and an educator.

I am asking for you to help me raise the funds necessary to pay for a portion of the trip, and in exchange you will receive perks that I have thoughtfully planned out. I will probably not get very far achieving my goal independently.  With your donations and support, you will have my eternal gratitude as I invite you to take part with me on my journey.


What I Need & What You Get 

I need to raise a minimum estimate of $3500 to cover the residency fee, accommodation and travel arrangements. The residency fee includes a studio and free use of the facilities equipped with large format printers and the software to make new work. It is not required for me to stay in campus housing, but it is the most affordable for my 4-week stay.

I am estimating around $1720 after exchange rate for these fees in addition to my travel expenses, which should be no more than $500.  If everything works out, my total expenses for the residency, accommodation and travel will be $2220. This should leave me with a little extra money for artist materials, food, and of course, fulfilling the perks!

In exchange for your support, you will receive prints from my existing body of work and other rewards that will be worth your donation and demonstrate my eternal gratitude. This includes a limited edition book exclusively made as a perk for this for this campaign.

You will receive any perks you choose in October 2016.  If for some reason I don’t reach my entire goal, I will still make sure you get your perk in a timely manner. In the mean time, you can stay updated on my work and this project through this campaign, email, and on Instagram @kristenmcnevins!

The Impact

Without your support, I would not be able to reserve my studio space in the residency program as soon I would like, and risking that this opportunity could get past on to the another person. I realize that this is a great opportunity for me to maintain and prioritize my studio practice now that I am out of school and more focused on a job. Applying and attending residencies at places like The Burren College of Art will help me to achieve my goal with rewarding experiences and references that will lead to fulfilling career as an artist, educator and more.

Thank you for time and support! Feel free to share this campaign to anyone you know who is interested!


Thank you,

Kristen

I think Ireland's stunning landscapes, and the thrill of
being in a place will provide a great source of inspiration for me, motivating
me to photograph more to add to my body of work. 
If you're interested, you can check out some of my current work at http://www.kristenmcnevins.com/.
Right now, I don't have much of a studio space or any means
to print my photographs, so I intend to use the facilities for digital printing
often. My primary purpose of this residency is to have the time and space to
focus and work on my own, but I am also interested in contributing to art and
college community at Burren College of Art during my four week stay. I hope that the experiences will cultivate feedback for my own work, as well as
add more skills necessary to be articulate as a lecturer and an educator.
I am asking for you to help me raise the funds necessary to pay for a portion of the trip, and in exchange you will receive perks that I have thoughtfully planned out. I will probably not get very far achieving my goal independently.  With your donations and support, you will have my eternal gratitude as I invite you to take part with me on my journey.   
What
I Need & What You Get  
I
need to raise a minimum estimate of $3500 to cover the residency fee, accommodation
and travel arrangements. The residency fee includes a studio and free use of
the facilities equipped with large format printers and the software to make new
work. It is not required for me to stay
in campus housing, but it is the most affordable for my 4-week stay. 
I am estimating around $1720 after exchange
rate for these fees in addition to my travel expenses, which should be no more
than $500.  If everything works out, my
total expenses for the residency, accommodation and travel will be $2220. This
should leave me with a little extra money for artist materials, food, and of
course, fulfilling the perks! 
In
exchange for your support, you will receive prints from my existing body of
work and other rewards that will be worth your donation and
demonstrate my eternal gratitude. This includes a limited edition book exclusively
made as a perk for this for this campaign. 
You
will receive any perks you choose in October 2016.  If for some reason I don’t reach
my entire goal, I will still make sure you get your perk in a timely manner. In
the mean time, you can stay updated on my work and this project through this campaign, email, and on Instagram @kristenmcnevins!
  
The
Impact
Without your support, I would not be able to reserve my studio space in the residency program as soon I would like, and risking that this opportunity could get past on to the another person. I realize that this is a great opportunity for me to maintain and prioritize my studio practice now that I am out of school and more focused on a job. Applying and attending residencies at places like The Burren College of Art will help me to achieve my goal with rewarding experiences and references that will lead to fulfilling career as an artist, educator and more.
Thank you for time and support! Feel free to share this campaign to anyone you know who is interested!
Thank you,Kristen

story:
Ithaca Pan Asian American Film Festival is dedicated to supporting Asian American film, video and media makers both nationwide and throughout the upstate New York area, promoting films created by, starring, and/or about Asian Americans.

Ithaca Pan Asian American Film Festival aims to: 
• Develop and support both emerging and experienced Asian American filmmakers and artists, working in a range of genres and styles. 
• Engage audience in a diverse and complex spectrum of Asian and Asian American works. 
• Present students with the opportunity to learn about Asian American film and gain event-planning skills.

Awards & Prizes

The IPAAFF is a non-competitive event.

Rules & Terms

ENTRY REGULATIONS 
The IPAAFF is a showcase for domestic and international feature films, documentaries and shorts. The IPAAFF Committee reserves the right to determine the eligibility of any project submitted. There is no limit to the number of entries.

ELIGIBILITY 
Feature film, short film, or video productions in any genre by Asian Americans and Asian International filmmakers, or with subject matter concerning Asian issues from any year, country, state, age, category, and serving any theme. No limit on the number of entries per person. Entry fee applies to each project submitted.

SUBMISSIONS 
The nonrefundable entry fee must be payable in US dollars to Ithaca Pan Asian American Film Festival. Entries must be POSTMARKED by the deadline. Submission costs vary depending on category and discounts. When submitting to the festival you are agreeing that if chosen to screen during the dates of the festival, IPAAFF will not pay any additional screening fees presented by the submitter. The only acceptation would be if it is agreed upon prior to a certain films submission.

CATEGORIES 
• Feature Length Film 
Feature Length Film submissions must have a total running time of 50 minutes or more. Films must be directed, produced, or principally acted by Asian Pacific Americans, even if the subject matter is not Asian. Non-Asian Pacific Americans may enter films if the subject matter is Asian Pacific American or Asian Diaspora related.

• Short Film 
Short film submissions must have a total running time of 30 minutes or less. Films must be directed, produced, or principally acted by Asian Pacific Americans, even if the subject matter is not Asian. Non-Asian Pacific Americans may enter films if the subject matter is Asian Pacific American or Asian Diaspora related.

• Youth film 
Youth film submissions must have a total running time of 20 minutes or less. Films must be directed, produced by Asian Pacific American Middle/High School students, even if the subject matter is not Asian. Non-Asian Pacific Americans may enter films if the subject matter is Asian Pacific American or Asian Diaspora related.

FILM/VIDEO ENTRIES 
All foreign language entries must have English subtitles. Projects must be submitted for consideration on DVD, BluRay or as an online screener. PAL format will not be accepted. Works in progress cannot be screened in the festival. Screening material, press and any application materials sent to IPAAFF will NOT be returned.

ENTRY DEADLINES 
All film submissions must be shipped prepaid and packed in proper containers to arrive at the IPAAFF office postmarked no later than their respective deadlines: March 10, 2015.

NOTIFICATION 
Films selected for the IPAAFF will be notified no later than April 1, 2015.

COMPETITION 
The IPAAFF is a non-competitive event.

ENTRY FORMATS 
Please label the DVD with your project title and your name. 
* Screener DVD / BluRay copy will be returned ONLY IF a self-addressed and stamped envelope is enclosed at the time of submission. 
• DVD or BluRay (2 copies are required) 
• Online Screener

EXHIBITION FORMATS 
Entries chosen for the festival may be exhibited in the formats listed below but the actual format is dependent on the venue and screening capabilities of each particular program. 
* We are not responsible for lost or damaged entries. 
• BluRay 
• Mov. File (Apple ProRes 4:2:2 is preferred.)

SUBMISSION FEE 
• Feature 
Standard: $30.00 / Student: $20.00 
• Short 
Standard: $20.00 / Student: $10.00 
• Youth 
$10.00

ENTRY SUBMISSION CHECKLIST 
1. Completed and Signed Submission Entry Form 
https://filmfreeway.com/festival/ithacapaaff 

2. Screener DVD (Mail to address below) OR 
Online Screener/Digital Files (Email to ipaaff@gmail.com with RE: Submission) 
3. Entry Fee 
4. (Optional) Self-addressed stamped envelope for the return of your screener. 
* Student Filmmakers, please attach a copy of School ID - Student Discounts available, please email us for code.

SUBMISSION MAILING 
Ithaca Pan Asian American Film Festival 
Ithaca College 
953 Danby Road 
Ithaca NY 14850

SHIPPING 
The cost of shipping entries and films to the festival must be paid by the entrant.

PRESS MATERIALS 
If selected, the IPAAFF will require an electronic press kit to include production stills, bio and filmography of the director, production notes and full cast and crew credits.

IF YOUR WORK IS ACCEPTED, PLEASE NOTE: 
• Exhibition film files and/or BluRay must be sent to the Festival pre-paid. 
• Return shipping of the exhibition copy within the United States will be covered by the Festival.

LIABILITY 
Although every possible care will be taken with tapes and films while in our possession, we cannot accept responsibility for loss or damage. Do not send original prints or tapes. Please keep the IPAAFF notified of any address/phone number changes.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS 
By submitting your entry to the Festival, you represent that you have the authority to do so and that you have reviewed all of the IPAAFF submission rules and information. You agree to hold IPAAFF harmless and without liability for the statements you make, and you assert that there are no assigned rights, agreements, distribution agreements, production deals or any arrangements whatsoever attached to this work that would in any way interfere with the showing or screening of your entry to the public within the terms of IPAAFF. You further acknowledge and agree that if your entry is selected for the Festival then you grant IPAAFF the rights to use footage, stills, titles and information from the film for current and future promotional, archival, and community engagement purposes.

story:
Me:

I am a Graduate student at the College of Architecture at IIT, Chicago. As much as I love to design, I love reading and writing about history of architecture as well.  I am from India and did my undergraduate degree in Architecture there. However IIT was an eye opener. It gave me opportunities to meet and work with architects, I had only dreamt of meeting in India. But like everything, the education here comes with a price. Although I have been pretty good for the 3 of my 4 years, the last semester is the one which is proving to be difficult and I know with your help and my skills, I can fulfill my dream. For me, education and career has always held greatest priority. I wish to pursue a PhD degree and write a good number of books in my lifetime. But for now, M.Arch degree is all I want. Architecture is not only my passion but my Love in life!

Why Paint?

I have been painting since I was three. Since the very beginning, I was not just interested in 'whatever' goes on the paper. It had to be something well thought of and aesthetically pleasing. My passion for painting kept me learning and trying out new methods and keep practicing them till perfection. Although, it would be brazen to say my work are masterpieces, I do put in extra effort to please people I paint for. And, I would do the same for you!

Wood:

One of the things IIT has taught me is woodworking. It is not only a passion but it is one of the things which relieves me of stress. Over the years, I have spent time in wood-shop trying to make new and ambitious projects. Due to limitation of time, I only offer smaller objects. However, I have worked on bigger pieces of furniture and would love to build for you if you wish for it. 

Thank you for taking the time and reading this. I appreciate your help in any form, money, advice, good wishes or just passing on the message to others. I hope you like you painting!

story:
Rhode Island does not have a permanent gallery or venue where Latino artists can expose their handmade art, be it paintings, jewelry or a place to offer small demonstration workshops in a bilingual format. 

This fundraising campaign is being coordinated by Rhode Island Latino Arts, and it will help us raise funds for a one-year commitment to rent and sustain a local cultural hub for Latino Art. 

    La Galería del Pueblo • The Village Gallery will be located in Pawtuxet Village, in the middle of a fast-growing destination for Rhode Islanders and visitors. It has a beautiful view of the bay, lots of great eateries and ever friendly residents. 

    Why Pawtuxet Village?

    Why Pawtuxet Village and why not in what one might consider the "heart of a Latino neighborhood" in an urban setting? The mission of Rhode Island Latino Arts is to build bridges, to connect and expose non-Latinos to the art and culture of our Spanish-speaking residents. We feel this neighborhood would appreciate local Latino arts, and store owners would welcome foot traffic and increased business.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      • Spread the word! Share this with your friends, family and colleagues.
      • Please donate today! We will be most grateful for your support!
      • We are looking for major investors/donors, but any small amount will help.
      • Support the arts - Buy Local!

We are looking for major investors/donors, but any small amount will help.
Support the arts - Buy Local!

story:
The MidCenturian illustrated tarot deck is a new undertaking, which began as a personal project for the artist known as Madam Clara. Clara wanted to create a tarot deck true to the imagery and archetypal symbolism in the iconic Rider-Waite deck, but abstracted and stylized with the optimism and whimsy of mid-century design. 

All of the illustrations are derived from a close study of the Rider-Waite, distilling each and every symbol to simple forms with a child-like freedom. Many of the hand-drawn and handcut shapes were then tediously digitized and repeated throughout the deck for continuity.

Card titles are very important in this deck, offering a very quick read, even in the low-light of a moody reading. Bold, graphic numbers and text occupy nearly a third of each card, but are incorporated within each and every design. Color harmonies refer back to the Rider-Waite, but with a mid-century design sensibility: bright, bold, sometimes unexpected, entirely modern.

story:
Welcome to the Black Rock Blind Tiger!

In the heart of the deep playa, curious structures rise sharply from the dust.  From the exterior they resemble a rustic workshop, littered with gears and gadgets that compose parts of a larger puzzle.  Vintage furniture, flickering chandeliers, and a welcoming porch beckon you to the entrance.  From the dimly-lit interior, faint strains of jazz and tinkling laughter emanate into the night.  Welcome, dear and dusty traveller, to the Black Rock Blind Tiger.

The Black Rock Blind Tiger is a novel speakeasy conceived around the idea of participation and play.  To gain access, you must solve the exterior puzzles and discover the password that allows entry.  Not in the mood for mysteries?  No worries, friend—the Black Rock Blind Tiger offers something for everyone, whether it’s a moment’s respite on the widow’s walk, or a garnished gift slipped to you through a secret drawer. 

Our team of artists and builders have built one of the structures already.  We are now transforming a 30-foot trailer into the interactive 1920s speakeasy for all Burning Man participants to experience and enjoy.  We’ll have interactive gifts, scintillating conversation, and excellent jazz music to keep you dancing the night away.  But the Black Rock Blind Tiger is more than just a speakeasy.  Join us and delight in the curious art, the unusual objects, and the many surprises that await you inside of the Black Rock Blind Tiger. 


The Inspiration

The Black Rock Blind Tiger is inspired by prohibition-era speakeasies, or secret drinking establishments that often required a password to gain entry.  Occasionally thirsty people skirted prohibition laws by acquiring “prescriptions” for “medicinal” drinks that were otherwise unlawful.  Sometimes these drinks were served through a secret drawer so that the identity of the server was never revealed. The name “Blind Tiger” itself is code for an illegal drinking establishment where the seller's identity was concealed.

Inside the "Outhouse of Conflict," part of the Black Rock Blind Tiger that went to Burning Flipside 2016.


The Team

The Black Rock Blind Tiger is based out of Austin, Texas and led by veteran Burning Man and Burning Flipside attendee Tiffaney Benson.  The team includes a 20+ person crew of artists, mixologists, builders, designers, and do’ers.  For more about our team, see our Team Bios page:  http://www.blackrockblindtiger.com/artist-and-team.html

The Outhouse of Conflict at Burning Flipside 2016.


Funding

We’re raising funds to transform our vintage Silver Streak trailer into a literal work of art.  To date we have raised $5,000 through local fundraisers, but we have about $10,000 remaining to meet our goal.  Our major expenses include building supplies, transportation, décor, gadgets, lighting, insurance, and tools.  For a breakdown of our budget by category, see our Funding page:  http://www.blackrockblindtiger.com/funding.html

The Black Rock Blind Tiger is a volunteer-led project supported entirely by our team members, fundraiser attendees, and Indiegogo campaign backers.  Your support of our campaign allows us to turn our dream of a community speakeasy on the playa into a reality.  We have already acquired our trailer and construction is currently underway! 

The future Black Rock Blind Tiger.

Perks

The Donor After Party:
Everyone (yes, everyone!) who donates $20 or more to the Indiegogo campaign will receive an invite and entrance to our donor after party.  After Burning Man, come see the Blind Tiger in all of its finished glory!  We'll drink and dance the night away in the speakeasy that YOU helped create.  Donor party is scheduled for October 29th in Manor, TX (about 20 minutes outside of Austin). The Blind Tiger presents: A Guy Fawkes All Hallows' Eve.   

Stickers:
For a $15 donation, get a cool Blind Tiger sticker to stick on all your things and a big thanks from us.  


Bandanas:
For a $20 donation, get a handy cotton bandana with our logo to wipe away all that playa dust.  And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.


Laser-etched pendants:
For a $35 donation, get a pendant laser-etched with our logo.  Your choice of plastic or wood.  Pendants measure about 5cm across. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.


Stainless steel mugs or logo flask:

For a $40 donation, get your choice of an insulated stainless mug with a screw top and a carabiner handle, OR a 6 oz. stainless steel flask with our logo engraved on it! And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.


Undies:
For a $50 donation, get a sweet pair of Blind Tiger undies, with a tiger on the front and our logo on the back.  Your choice of sexy style and size from meundies.com (the most comfortable undies in the world).  Choose either black with orange logo or orange with black logo. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.

Pictured:  men's black "trunk" style and orange women's "cheeky briefs."   The logo on the bandana appears on the back of the undies.

T-shirts:
For a $50 donation, get a t-shirt with our logo screen-printed on the front and a Humphrey Bogart quote on the back--"The problem with the world is that everyone is a few drinks behind."  T-shirts are black, crew neck, 50/50 ring spun combed cotton and polyester for softness and durability.  Available in either men's or women's sizes XS-4X. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.

Shirt design.

Women's t-shirt style.

Men's t-shirt style.

Hoodies:
For a $75 donation, Stay warm and get a hoodie with our logo screen-printed on the front and a Humphrey Bogart quote on the back--"The problem with the world is that everyone is a few drinks behind."  Hoodies are pull-over style in 50/50 cotton and poly fleece.  Men's sizes S-4X. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.

Hoodie design is the same as the t-shirt.

The hoodie you'll receive!


T-shirts + undies:

For a $85 donation, get both a t-shirt and a pair of undies! And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.

Bar glasses:
For a $100 donation, get 4 swanky highball glasses with our logo laser-etched on them.  Glasses are 12 oz. with a gold honeycomb design (handwash only). And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.



Decanter + bar glasses:
For a $200 donation, get both a decanter and a set of bar glasses with our logo etched onto them.  Your choice of color:  silver, gold, or copper.  The decanter is 40.5 oz. and the glasses are 9.8 oz.  Handwash only. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.


Speakeasy party:
For a $1500 donation, the Blind Tiger is yours to enjoy for five hours!  Invite up to 20 guests and we'll provide the booze.  We can deliver the speakeasy anywhere in the Austin, TX area as long as you have a place to park it!  For questions about this perk, contact tiffaney@blackrockblindtiger.com. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.


Other Ways to Help

If you want to make a non-monetary donation, contact the Blind Tiger team at blackrockblindtiger@gmail.com.  We are in need of vintage furniture and knick-knacks, building supplies, gas and grocery gift cards, alcohol, and many other things!


Learn More

http://www.blackrockblindtiger.com/

https://www.facebook.com/blackrockblindtiger/

The Team

The Black Rock Blind Tiger is based out of Austin, Texas and
led by veteran Burning Man and Burning Flipside attendee Tiffaney Benson.  The team includes a 20+ person crew of artists,
mixologists, builders, designers, and do’ers. 
For more about our team, see our Team Bios page:  http://www.blackrockblindtiger.com/artist-and-team.html


The Outhouse of Conflict at Burning Flipside 2016.

Funding

We’re raising funds to transform our vintage Silver Streak
trailer into a literal work of art.  To
date we have raised $5,000 through local fundraisers, but we have about $10,000
remaining to meet our goal.  Our major
expenses include building supplies, transportation, décor, gadgets, lighting, insurance, and tools.  For a
breakdown of our budget by category, see our Funding page:  http://www.blackrockblindtiger.com/funding.html
The Black Rock Blind Tiger is a volunteer-led project
supported entirely by our team members, fundraiser attendees, and Indiegogo
campaign backers.  Your support of our
campaign allows us to turn our dream of a community speakeasy on the playa into
a reality.  We have already acquired our
trailer and construction is currently underway! 


The future Black Rock Blind Tiger.

Perks

The Donor After Party:Everyone (yes, everyone!) who donates $20 or more to the Indiegogo campaign will receive an invite and entrance to our donor after party.  After Burning Man, come see the Blind Tiger in all of its finished glory!  We'll drink and dance the night away in the speakeasy that YOU helped create.  Donor party is scheduled for October 29th in Manor, TX (about 20 minutes outside of Austin). The Blind Tiger presents: A Guy Fawkes All Hallows' Eve.   Stickers:For a $15 donation, get a cool Blind Tiger sticker to stick on all your things and a big thanks from us.  


Bandanas:For a $20 donation, get a handy cotton bandana with our logo to wipe away all that playa dust.  And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.

Laser-etched pendants:For a $35 donation, get a pendant laser-etched with our logo.  Your choice of plastic or wood.  Pendants measure about 5cm across. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.





Stainless steel mugs or logo flask:
For a $40 donation, get your choice of an insulated stainless mug with a screw top and a carabiner handle, OR a 6 oz. stainless steel flask with our logo engraved on it! And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.



Undies:For a $50 donation, get a sweet pair of Blind Tiger undies, with a tiger on the front and our logo on the back.  Your choice of sexy style and size from meundies.com (the most comfortable undies in the world).  Choose either black with orange logo or orange with black logo. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.

Pictured:  men's black "trunk" style and orange women's "cheeky briefs."   The logo on the bandana appears on the back of the undies.
T-shirts:For a $50 donation, get a t-shirt with our logo screen-printed on the front and a Humphrey Bogart quote on the back--"The problem with the world is that everyone is a few drinks behind."  T-shirts are black, crew neck, 50/50 ring spun combed cotton and polyester for softness and durability.  Available in either men's or women's sizes XS-4X. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.

Shirt design.


Women's t-shirt style.


Men's t-shirt style.
Hoodies:For a $75 donation, Stay warm and get a hoodie with our logo screen-printed on the front and a Humphrey Bogart quote on the back--"The problem with the world is that everyone is a few drinks behind."  Hoodies are pull-over style in 50/50 cotton and poly fleece.  Men's sizes S-4X. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.

Hoodie design is the same as the t-shirt.


The hoodie you'll receive!


T-shirts + undies:
For a $85 donation, get both a t-shirt and a pair of undies! And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.
Bar glasses:For a $100 donation, get 4 swanky highball glasses with our logo laser-etched on them.  Glasses are 12 oz. with a gold honeycomb design (handwash only). And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.




Decanter + bar glasses:For a $200 donation, get both a decanter and a set of bar glasses with our logo etched onto them.  Your choice of color:  silver, gold, or copper.  The decanter is 40.5 oz. and the glasses are 9.8 oz.  Handwash only. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.



Speakeasy party:For a $1500 donation, the Blind Tiger is yours to enjoy for five hours!  Invite up to 20 guests and we'll provide the booze.  We can deliver the speakeasy anywhere in the Austin, TX area as long as you have a place to park it!  For questions about this perk, contact tiffaney@blackrockblindtiger.com. And entrance into the after party on Oct. 29th.


Other Ways to HelpIf you want to make a non-monetary donation, contact the Blind Tiger team at blackrockblindtiger@gmail.com.  We are in need of vintage furniture and knick-knacks, building supplies, gas and grocery gift cards, alcohol, and many other things!
Learn More


http://www.blackrockblindtiger.com/
https://www.facebook.com/blackrockblindtiger/

story:
The Normal House is a small, intentional, co-housing community in the Normal Heights neighborhood of San Diego founded in the fall of 2012.


The Normal House is a place where you have permission, support and encouragement.  A place where we push each other to find a way of living that is respectful, responsible, and loving, yet progressive.  We help each other safely push past our comfort zone, to experience new and exciting things in a positive, enriching way.


Do it often enough and it becomes the New Normal.




The Normal House wants to enlist your help to paint a mural facing 36th Ave., near Adams Ave. as part of the Art Around Adams event on June 4th 2016. This project is inspired by the children’s book The Big Orange Splot.




In the book, Mr. Plumbean paints his house not to fit in, but to look like his dreams. At first his neighbors are mad, but after talking with each of them individually, Mr. Plumbean convinces them to paint their houses to look like their dreams as well.



In the end, all his neighbors declare: "Our street is us and we are it. Our street is where we like to be, and it looks like all our dreams."



HELP US PAINT A MURAL:

Our motivation:


Community engagement - we are going to paint the front of our house as part of Art Around Adams, on June 4, 2016. This is a free event that showcases creative talent and businesses in Normal Heights. We want members of our community to help us with this interactive art project! The mural - like the Normal House - is part of the neighborhood, and we want our house to be a reflection of that interactive, creative spirit.


"Creating a New Normal" - our vision statement is to create a New Normal in our community and in the city of San Diego. Help us transform what it means to be a building, a house, and a community.


Adding color to our neighborhood - the Normal House community is invested in creating all kinds of interactive art. Here are some projects that we have done in the past:



For Art Around Adams 2015 we set up our Book Pond, an interactive space for playing with books in a tactile way.



The Couch Swing has made appearances at a variety of festivals, including Burning Man. The rest of the time it resides in the Normal House courtyard.


DONATE:

Please view our perks to see what you get when you donate!


OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

Come to Art Around Adams on Saturday, June 4th, 2016. Help us paint! Paint whatever you like! All skills levels and ages are welcome.


Share this funding campaign on social media. Help spread the word!

story:
The Bucky Ball Pit

Buckminster Fuller was a da Vinci of the 20th century - a poet, an engineer, a futurist, a polymath. He spent his life discovering and utilizing natures coordinate system in order to make the world work for 100% of humanity. He found that the closest packing of spheres (or balls, if you will) revealed the underlying structure of the universe, upon which 3.8 billion years of life on earth had designed itself.


The Bucky Ball Pit is inspired by the life and work of Buckminster Fuller who peeled back the layers of the reality he was born into and looked at it from a fresh perspective. You will literally crawl inside his mind made of a geodesic dome, a bounce house and a ball pit, seeing the world as he saw it, but most importantly you will be inspired to do your own thinking. 

There will be many avenues for learning about Bucky in the ball pit. We are designing a custom VR experience that will guide you through Bucky's understanding of nature's coordinate system. We will be screening his 42-hour long lecture titled "Everything I Know" layered with ambient music. There will be lectures both planned and impromptu, books, posters, models and much much more. 

We are also building The Bucky Neurological Translator by which Buckminster Fuller explanation and insight is absorbed by an individual.  The individual's autonomic nervous system is influenced by the feelings associated with this absorbed data.  A basis physiological expression associated with both the sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous system is then expressed into the Bucky ball volume.  Those meandering through the volume feel a auditory and tactile pressure reflective of this nervous system state.  A novel and fundamental communication is enabled to connect abstract Bucky thoughts with core physiological state. 

This project will be brought back to the playa adjacent (formally known as the default world) after burning man and set up at events, conferences, festivals, city parks, and many other venues. We're committed to growing this project, enhancing the VR experience and offering it to as many people as possible. 

 

Imagine This

You are a dusty hot mess in the best kind of way. The conditions for epiphany are riper than that peach rolling around at the bottom of your backpack. You’re steeped in the experiment-in-community that is burning man, the gifting economy keeps delivering serendipity to you in shovel fulls, the harsh climate is testing your limits, you’re facing your triggers, un-imprinting past traumas, surrounded by smiling authentic faces, and perhaps have invited entheogens into the mix. Mini-epiphanies and even the larger kind are waiting with baited breath to thrill your mind, body, and soul. You and 70 thousand others are exploring the life’s work of a great renaissance man, Da Vinci, a man inspired by nature’s coordinate system, a man so creative that some of his designs and models still have not been built.

 

Then a friend pulls you into a ball pit. You think, hey this is a nice fun comfy respite from it all. Then you realize it’s themed Buckminster Fuller, the Da Vinci of the 20th century, a polymath- a futurist, poet, writer, architect, inventor, and as most burners are aware- the inventor of the geodesic dome! You look around at the dome that is covering the ball pit and see quotes of his, models of his explorations in geometry, and a gorgeous geometric art installation on the ceiling behind it all. You see triangles, hexagons, and spheres everywhere.

 

Then a friendly host hands you a Virtual Reality headset and asks: “would you like to become re-enchanted with the fundamental coordinate system of the universe? You slide it on and immerse yourself in an exploration in nature’s coordinate system. You learn about simple shapes like tetrahedrons and more complex ones like the vector equilibrium. You learn the definition of Synergetics: the empirical study of systems in transformation, with an emphasis on total system behavior unpredicted by the behavior of any isolated components, including humanity's role as both participant and observer. You are inside an experience that has been designed to reorient your fundamental understanding of the universe. You have an epiphany: Universe is an abstraction,  but when you understand how it works you can become an active participant instead of a passive observer. Woah.

 

If you are there at the right time you’ll also be set up with bio sensor that will take your heart-rate, and visualize it on the dome above you.

 

If you are there between 5-7 you will also participate in a Geometry of Thinking workshop . You’ll make your own models to take home and tools for teaching others about spheres, nanotech, biomimicry and how the universe works.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we need monies for: 

  • An inflatable giant Buckminster Fuller head that will house the balls made by a talented maker from Colorado
  • Virtual Reality headsets, cameras, and development of a unique VR experience for inside the pit inside the head.
  • A quality speaker and subwoofer system for the Neurological Translator system.
  • 40,000 Balls (already sourced, BPA free and mostly upcycled from other art installations in the Bay area)
  • LED lights that will coordinate with your heart beat. 
  • Equipment for the Neurological Translator
  • Buckminster Fuller Decor: Synergetics Models, Posters and Books
  • Storage so we can bring it to local parties in the bay area throughout the year and back to burning man next year!

 

The Perks

  • A Gold Bucky Ball 3D-Printed Necklace

  • A Silver 3D-Printed Bracelet

  • A Custom VR Headset with Buckyball Design

  • Your message on a ball in the pit
  • Sticker Set
  • Bucky ball print by Libby Flack

​

* Bucky Ball Pit Print: 

The Impact

We aim to host around 2500 people in the ball pit at an average of 15/hour x 7 days. Every person will have at least one of the following experiences: 

  • Play in a ball pit and enjoy a respite from the heat/dust/overwhelm etc.
  • Participate in custom Virtual Reality experiences, taking you around our spaceship earth and learning how the universe works 
  • Learn about the life and work of Buckminster Fuller through the quotes of his written on the balls, synergetics models, his books available for reading in the pit, his lectures playing on audio, or any of the other learning opportunities inside Bucky's mind
  • Participate in a "Geometry of Thinking" hands-on workshop on Tuesday-Friday from 5-7 in which participants will learn about Synergetics, a comprehensive energetic geometry system developed by Bucky, through hands-on model building in the ball pit.
  • Have a life-changing epiphany that leads them to transform the world so that it may "work for 100% of humanity".

Risks & Challenges

The playa is a tricky place for technology. The neurological translator component may break. We have some pretty handy people around who will likely be able to fix it, but no promises. Luckily the balls wont break so there will still be fun for everyone! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to contribute or not you can help by: 

  • Coming to the Bucky Ball Pit at Burning Man and telling all your friends to come too!
  • Getting the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

"We are called to be architects of the future, not its victims." - R. Buckminster Fuller

 

 

IDEATE, our Burning Man Camp

IDEATE cultivates a global community that embodies and perpetuates the principles of Burning Man in the World and, of course, has a ridiculously good time doing it. At IDEATE we are cultivating best practices for resiliency – how we treat each other, how we leave things (better than we found them), and how food, waste, and water are handled. We see Burning Man as a testing ground for innovation that will change the world and it is our aim to design for RADICAL REGENERATION starting with our own behavior and our systems as a camp. 

 

"If success or failure of this planet and of human beings depended on how I am and what I do… HOW WOULD I BE? WHAT WOULD I DO?" -R. Buckminster Fuller

story:
Hey everyone, I'm Nina Browwn, a R&B/Pop recording artist based in Toronto, Canada looking to raise funds for some new projects to further my music career.

My goal with this campaign is to raise enough funds to be able to record more music, help my band out as well who have been working so hard with me at rehearsals to prepare for shows and really just be able to impact more people with music. 

With your support, I truly feel that I will be able to deliver an outstanding product that will appeal to all ages and types of people. Nothing makes me happier than when someone tells me how my music touched them and resonated with them because they had been through similar situations as the topics of my songs. By reaching out and supporting me, you'll be apart of something great that I am truly humbled about and proud of! I won't disappoint, I can promise you that! 

My goal with the funds raised is to put them towards another EP project which will contain 5-6 new songs that really touch on some very personal topics and situations I have been through in my life and thanks to music, I was able to overcome them and move forward.

The funds will also be used to promote my project once completed, to put on shows locally, build my brand through exposure and also help the community through music. 

By contributing to my campaign, you can be sure that I intend to send out free CDs signed by me to each of you, I intend to get Nina Browwn swag for you guys such as merchandise. But most importantly, I want to sing for you guys! So... if you guys need someone to perform for any events for you locally in Toronto, I'm your girl! I want to have fun with you guys, I want you to enjoy yourselves with me and really just have a great time! 

Every little bit helps! Achieving the goal of $15,000 is a tall order and definitely NO easy task but I believe it's doable. Even if we don't make it to that dollar amount, whatever is raised will be going first into making the music and then into showing it off to the world!

My last project has been getting a lot of attention through Social Media and music platforms. On SoundCloud, I have over 600,000 plays of my songs and have been getting a lot of positive feedback from the Canadian market as well as in LA where I have been trying to breakthrough as well. I don't mind sleepless nights if it means that the end goal will be achieved!

I can say that with every dollar of support, it only makes me more hungry and eager to create and make all of my supporters and fans proud of what I am doing. It humbles me to know that people genuinely care about other people and those who have taken a leap of faith to follow their dreams! We can make it happen together, this I know in my heart! 

I would love to reach as many people as possible and with your help by spreading the word, this will be possible. Let your friends, family, coworkers know that they can be apart of something special and powerful. I genuinely believe that we all have a passion for music somewhere inside of us and it affects us all in different ways. 

I know it won't be easy and my journey is far from over, with lots of challenges ahead of me but I feel like I have been preparing for this my whole life and feel like there is no time like the present to make it happen. I am so blessed to already have an amazing following of people who love and support me and what I do so I can't wait to see what's all this has in store for me next. I plan to pay if forward and make sure that I do all I can to help others who also want to fight and not give up on their dreams.
